117.Rashad Khalifa: We gave both of them the profound scripture.

118.Rashad Khalifa: We guided them in the right path.

119.Rashad Khalifa: We preserved their history for subsequent generations.

120.Rashad Khalifa: Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.

122.Rashad Khalifa: Both of them were among our righteous servants.

123.Rashad Khalifa: Elias was one of the messengers.

124.Rashad Khalifa: He said to his people, "Would you not work righteousness?

125.Rashad Khalifa: "Do you worship a statue, instead of the Supreme Creator?

126.Rashad Khalifa: "GOD; your Lord, and the Lord of your forefathers!"

127.Rashad Khalifa: They disbelieved him. Consequently, they had to be called to account.

128.Rashad Khalifa: Only GOD's servants who are absolutely devoted to Him alone (are saved).

129.Rashad Khalifa: We preserved his history for subsequent generations.

130.Rashad Khalifa: Peace be upon Elias, and all those like Elias.

132.Rashad Khalifa: He was one of our believing servants.

133.Rashad Khalifa: Lot was one of the messengers.

134.Rashad Khalifa: We saved him and all his family.

135.Rashad Khalifa: Only the old woman was doomed.

137.Rashad Khalifa: You still pass by their ruins by day.

138.Rashad Khalifa: And by night. Would you understand?

139.Rashad Khalifa: Jonah was one of the messengers.

140.Rashad Khalifa: He escaped to the loaded ship.

141.Rashad Khalifa: He rebelled and thus, he joined the losers.

142.Rashad Khalifa: Consequently, the fish swallowed him, and he was the one to blame.

143.Rashad Khalifa: If it were not that he resorted to meditation (on God),

144.Rashad Khalifa: he would have stayed in its belly until the Day of Resurrection.

145.Rashad Khalifa: We had him thrown up into the desert, exhausted.

146.Rashad Khalifa: We had a tree of edible fruit grown for him.

147.Rashad Khalifa: Then we sent him to a hundred thousand, or more.

148.Rashad Khalifa: They did believe, and we let them enjoy this life.

149.Rashad Khalifa: Ask them if your Lord have daughters, while they have sons!

150.Rashad Khalifa: Did we create the angels to be females? Did they witness that?

151.Rashad Khalifa: Indeed, they grossly blaspheme when they say -

152.Rashad Khalifa: "GOD has begotten a son." Indeed, they are liars.

153.Rashad Khalifa: Did He choose the girls over the boys?

154.Rashad Khalifa: What is wrong with your logic?

155.Rashad Khalifa: Why do you not take heed?

157.Rashad Khalifa: Show us your book, if you are truthful.

158.Rashad Khalifa: They even invented a special relationship between Him and the jinns. The jinns themselves know that they are subservient.

159.Rashad Khalifa: GOD be glorified; far above their claims.

160.Rashad Khalifa: Only GOD's servants who are devoted to Him alone (are saved).

161.Rashad Khalifa: Indeed, you and what you worship.

163.Rashad Khalifa: Only you will burn in Hell.

164.Rashad Khalifa: Each one of us has a specific job.

168.Rashad Khalifa: "Had we received the correct instructions from our parents,

169.Rashad Khalifa: "we would have been worshipers; devoted to GOD alone."

170.Rashad Khalifa: But they disbelieved, and they will surely find out.

171.Rashad Khalifa: Our decision is already decreed for our servants the messengers.

175.Rashad Khalifa: Watch them; they too will watch.

177.Rashad Khalifa: When it hits them one day, it will be a miserable day; they have been sufficiently warned.

179.Rashad Khalifa: Watch them; they too will watch.

180.Rashad Khalifa: Glory be to your Lord, the great Lord; far above their claims.

182.Rashad Khalifa: Praise be to GOD, Lord of the universe.

1.Rashad Khalifa: S. (Saad), and the Quran that contains the proof.

2.Rashad Khalifa: Those who disbelieve have plunged into arrogance and defiance.

3.Rashad Khalifa: Many a generation before them we annihilated. They called for help, in vain.

4.Rashad Khalifa: They wondered that a warner should come to them, from among them. The disbelievers said, "A magician, a liar.

5.Rashad Khalifa: "Did he make the gods into one god? This is really strange."

6.Rashad Khalifa: The leaders announced, "Go and steadfastly persevere in worshiping your gods. This is what is desired.

7.Rashad Khalifa: "We never heard of this from the religion of our fathers. This is a lie.

8.Rashad Khalifa: "Why did the proof come down to him, instead of us?" Indeed, they are doubtful of My proof. Indeed, they have not yet tasted My retribution.

9.Rashad Khalifa: Do they own the treasures of mercy of your Lord, the Almighty, the Grantor.

10.Rashad Khalifa: Do they possess the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them? Let them help themselves.

11.Rashad Khalifa: Instead, whatever forces they can muster - even if all their parties banded together - will be defeated.

12.Rashad Khalifa: Disbelieving before them were the people of Noah, `Aad, and the mighty Pharaoh.

13.Rashad Khalifa: Also, Thamoud, the people of Lot, the dwellers of the Woods (of Midyan); those were the opponents.

14.Rashad Khalifa: Each of them disbelieved the messengers and thus, My retribution was inevitable.

15.Rashad Khalifa: These people can expect a single blow, from which they never recover.

16.Rashad Khalifa: They challenged: "Our Lord, why do you not rush the retribution for us, before the Day of Reckoning."

17.Rashad Khalifa: Be patient in the face of their utterances, and remember our servant David, the resourceful; he was obedient.

18.Rashad Khalifa: We committed the mountains in his service, glorifying with him night and day.

19.Rashad Khalifa: Also the birds were committed to serve him; all were obedient to him.

20.Rashad Khalifa: We strengthened his kingship, and endowed him with wisdom and good logic.

21.Rashad Khalifa: Have you received news of the feuding men who sneaked into his sanctuary?

22.Rashad Khalifa: When they entered his room, he was startled. They said, "Have no fear. We are feuding with one another, and we are seeking your fair judgment. Do not wrong us, and guide us in the right path.

23.Rashad Khalifa: "This brother of mine owns ninety nine sheep, while I own one sheep. He wants to mix my sheep with his, and continues to pressure me."

24.Rashad Khalifa: He said, "He is being unfair to you by asking to combine your sheep with his. Most people who combine their properties treat each other unfairly, except those who believe and work righteousness, and these are so few." Afterwards, David wondered if he made the right judgment. He thought that we were testing him. He then implored his Lord for forgiveness, bowed down, and repented.

25.Rashad Khalifa: We forgave him in this matter. We have granted him a position of honor with us, and a beautiful abode.

26.Rashad Khalifa: O David, we have made you a ruler on earth. Therefore, you shall judge among the people equitably, and do not follow your personal opinion, lest it diverts you from the way of GOD. Surely, those who stray off the way of GOD incur severe retribution for forgetting the Day of Reckoning.

27.Rashad Khalifa: We did not create the heaven and the earth, and everything between them, in vain. Such is the thinking of those who disbelieve. Therefore, woe to those who disbelieve; they will suffer in Hell.

28.Rashad Khalifa: Shall we treat those who believe and lead a righteous life as we treat those who commit evil on earth? Shall we treat the righteous as we treat the wicked?

29.Rashad Khalifa: This is a scripture that we sent down to you, that is sacred - perhaps they reflect on its verses. Those who possess intelligence will take heed.

30.Rashad Khalifa: To David we granted Solomon; a good and obedient servant.

31.Rashad Khalifa: One day he became preoccupied with beautiful horses, until the night fell.

32.Rashad Khalifa: He then said, "I enjoyed the material things more than I enjoyed worshiping my Lord, until the sun was gone.

33.Rashad Khalifa: "Bring them back." (To bid farewell,) he rubbed their legs and necks.

34.Rashad Khalifa: We thus put Solomon to the test; we blessed him with vast material wealth, but he steadfastly submitted.

35.Rashad Khalifa: He said, "My Lord, forgive me, and grant me a kingship never attained by anyone else. You are the Grantor."

36.Rashad Khalifa: We (answered his prayer and) committed the wind at his disposal, pouring rain wherever he wanted.

37.Rashad Khalifa: And the devils, building and diving.

38.Rashad Khalifa: Others were placed at his disposal.

39.Rashad Khalifa: "This is our provision to you; you may give generously, or withhold, without limits."

40.Rashad Khalifa: He has deserved an honorable position with us, and a wonderful abode.

41.Rashad Khalifa: Remember our servant Job: he called upon his Lord, "The devil has afflicted me with hardship and pain."

42.Rashad Khalifa: "Strike the ground with your foot. A spring will give you healing and a drink."

43.Rashad Khalifa: We restored his family for him; twice as many. Such is our mercy; a reminder for those who possess intelligence.

44.Rashad Khalifa: "Now, you shall travel the land and preach the message, to fulfill your pledge." We found him steadfast. What a good servant! He was a submitter.

45.Rashad Khalifa: Remember also our servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. They were resourceful, and possessed vision.

46.Rashad Khalifa: We bestowed upon them a great blessing: awareness of the Hereafter.

47.Rashad Khalifa: They were chosen, for they were among the most righteous.

48.Rashad Khalifa: Remember Ismail, Elisha, and Zal-Kifl; among the most righteous.

49.Rashad Khalifa: This is a reminder: the righteous have deserved a wonderful destiny.

50.Rashad Khalifa: The gardens of Eden will open up their gates for them.

51.Rashad Khalifa: Relaxing therein, they will be given many kinds of fruits and drinks.

52.Rashad Khalifa: They will have wonderful spouses.

53.Rashad Khalifa: This is what you have deserved on the Day of Reckoning.

54.Rashad Khalifa: Our provisions are inexhaustible.

55.Rashad Khalifa: As for the transgressors, they have incurred a miserable destiny.

56.Rashad Khalifa: Hell is where they burn; what a miserable abode!

57.Rashad Khalifa: What they taste therein will be hellish drinks and bitter food.

58.Rashad Khalifa: And much more of the same kind.

59.Rashad Khalifa: "This is a group to be thrown into Hell with you." They will not be welcomed (by the residents of Hell). They have deserved to burn in the hellfire.

60.Rashad Khalifa: The newcomers will respond, "Nor are you welcomed. You are the ones who preceded us and misled us. Therefore, suffer this miserable end."

61.Rashad Khalifa: They will also say, "Our Lord, these are the ones who led us into this; double the retribution of hellfire for them."

62.Rashad Khalifa: They will say, "How come we do not see (in Hell) people we used to count among the wicked?

63.Rashad Khalifa: "We used to ridicule them; we used to turn our eyes away from them."

64.Rashad Khalifa: This is a predetermined fact: the people of Hell will feud with one another.

65.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "I warn you; there is no other god beside GOD, the One, the Supreme.

66.Rashad Khalifa: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them; the Almighty, the Forgiving."

67.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "Here is awesome news.

68.Rashad Khalifa: "That you are totally oblivious to.

69.Rashad Khalifa: "I had no knowledge previously, about the feud in the High Society.

70.Rashad Khalifa: "I am inspired that my sole mission is to deliver the warnings to you."

71.Rashad Khalifa: Your Lord said to the angels, "I am creating a human being from clay.

72.Rashad Khalifa: "Once I design him, and blow into him from My spirit, you shall fall prostrate before him."

73.Rashad Khalifa: The angels fell prostrate, all of them,

74.Rashad Khalifa: except Satan; he refused, and was too arrogant, unappreciative.

75.Rashad Khalifa: He said, "O Satan, what prevented you from prostrating before what I created with My hands? Are you too arrogant? Have you rebelled?"

76.Rashad Khalifa: He said, "I am better than he; You created me from fire, and created him from clay."

77.Rashad Khalifa: He said, "Therefore, you must be exiled, you will be banished.

78.Rashad Khalifa: "You have incurred My condemnation until the Day of Judgment."

79.Rashad Khalifa: He said, "My Lord, respite me till the Day of Resurrection."

80.Rashad Khalifa: He said, "You are respited.

81.Rashad Khalifa: "Until the appointed day."

82.Rashad Khalifa: He said, "I swear by Your majesty, that I will send them all astray.

83.Rashad Khalifa: "Except Your worshipers who are devoted absolutely to You alone."

84.Rashad Khalifa: He said, "This is the truth, and the truth is all that I utter.

85.Rashad Khalifa: "I will fill Hell with you and all those who follow you."

86.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "I do not ask you for any wage, and I am not an imposter.

87.Rashad Khalifa: "This is a reminder for the world.

88.Rashad Khalifa: "And you will certainly find out in awhile."

1.Rashad Khalifa: This is a revelation of the scripture, from GOD, the Almighty, the Wise.

2.Rashad Khalifa: We sent down to you this scripture, truthfully; you shall worship GOD, devoting your religion to Him alone.

3.Rashad Khalifa: Absolutely, the religion shall be devoted to GOD alone. Those who set up idols beside Him say, "We idolize them only to bring us closer to GOD; for they are in a better position!" GOD will judge them regarding their disputes. GOD does not guide such liars, disbelievers.

4.Rashad Khalifa: If GOD wanted to have a son, He could have chosen whomever He willed from among His creations. Be He glorified; He is GOD, the One, the Supreme.

5.Rashad Khalifa: He created the heavens and the earth truthfully. He rolls the night over the day, and rolls the day over the night. He committed the sun and the moon, each running for a finite period. Absolutely, He is the Almighty, the Forgiving

6.Rashad Khalifa: He created you from one person, then created from him his mate. He sent down to you eight kinds of livestock. He creates you in your mothers' bellies, creation after creation, in trimesters of darkness. Such is GOD your Lord. To Him belongs all sovereignty. There is no other god beside Him. How could you deviate?

7.Rashad Khalifa: If you disbelieve, GOD does not need anyone. But He dislikes to see His servants make the wrong decision. If you decide to be appreciative, He is pleased for you. No soul bears the sins of any other soul. Ultimately, to your Lord is your return, then He will inform you of everything you had done. He is fully aware of the innermost thoughts.

8.Rashad Khalifa: When the human being is afflicted, he implores his Lord, sincerely devoted to Him. But as soon as He blesses him, he forgets his previous imploring, sets up idols to rank with GOD and to divert others from His path. Say, "Enjoy your disbelief temporarily; you have incurred the hellfire."

9.Rashad Khalifa: Is it not better to be one of those who meditate in the night, prostrating and staying up, being aware of the Hereafter, and seeking the mercy of their Lord? Say, "Are those who know equal to those who do not know?" Only those who possess intelligence will take heed.

10.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "O My servants who believed, you shall reverence your Lord." For those who worked righteousness in this world, a good reward. GOD's earth is spacious, and those who steadfastly persevere will receive their recompense generously, without limits.

11.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "I have been commanded to worship GOD, devoting the religion absolutely to Him alone.

12.Rashad Khalifa: "And I was commanded to be the utmost submitter."

13.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "I fear, if I disobeyed my Lord, the retribution of a great day."

14.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "GOD is the only One I worship, devoting my religion absolutely to Him alone.

15.Rashad Khalifa: "Therefore, worship whatever you wish beside Him." Say, "The real losers are those who lose their souls, and their families, on the Day of Resurrection." Most certainly, this is the real loss.

16.Rashad Khalifa: They will have masses of fire on top of them, and under them. GOD thus alerts His servants: O My servants, you shall reverence Me.

17.Rashad Khalifa: As for those who discard the worship of all idols, and devote themselves totally to GOD alone, they have deserved happiness. Give good news to My servants.

18.Rashad Khalifa: They are the ones who examine all words, then follow the best. These are the ones whom GOD has guided; these are the ones who possess intelligence.

19.Rashad Khalifa: With regard to those who have deserved the retribution, can you save those who are already in Hell?

20.Rashad Khalifa: As for those who reverence their Lord, they will have mansions upon mansions constructed for them, with flowing streams. This is GOD's promise, and GOD never breaks His promise.

21.Rashad Khalifa: Do you not see that GOD sends down from the sky water, then places it into underground wells, then produces with it plants of various colors, then they grow until they turn yellow, then He turns them into hay? This should be a reminder for those who possess intelligence.

22.Rashad Khalifa: If GOD renders one's heart content with Submission, he will be following a light from his Lord. Therefore, woe to those whose hearts are hardened against GOD's message; they have gone far astray.

23.Rashad Khalifa: GOD has revealed herein the best Hadith; a book that is consistent, and points out both ways (to Heaven and Hell). The skins of those who reverence their Lord cringe therefrom, then their skins and their hearts soften up for GOD's message. Such is GOD's guidance; He bestows it upon whoever wills (to be guided). As for those sent astray by GOD, nothing can guide them.

24.Rashad Khalifa: What is better than saving one's face from the terrible retribution on the Day of Resurrection? The transgressors will be told, "Taste the consequences of what you earned."

25.Rashad Khalifa: Others before them have disbelieved and, consequently, the retribution afflicted them whence they never expected.

26.Rashad Khalifa: GOD has condemned them to humiliation in this life, and the retribution in the Hereafter will be far worse, if they only knew.

27.Rashad Khalifa: We have cited for the people every kind of example in this Quran, that they may take heed.

28.Rashad Khalifa: An Arabic Quran, without any ambiguity, that they may be righteous.

29.Rashad Khalifa: GOD cites the example of a man who deals with disputing partners (Hadith), compared to a man who deals with only one consistent source (Quran). Are they the same? Praise be to GOD; most of them do not know.

30.Rashad Khalifa: You (Muhammad) will surely die, just like they will die.

31.Rashad Khalifa: On the Day of Resurrection, before your Lord, you people will feud with one another.

32.Rashad Khalifa: Who is more evil than one who attributes lies to GOD, while disbelieving in the truth that has come to him? Is Hell not a just requital for the disbelievers?

33.Rashad Khalifa: As for those who promote the truth, and believe therein, they are the righteous.

34.Rashad Khalifa: They will get everything they wish, at their Lord. Such is the reward for the righteous.

35.Rashad Khalifa: GOD remits their sinful works, and rewards them generously for their good works.

36.Rashad Khalifa: Is GOD not sufficient for His servant? They frighten you with the idols they set up beside Him. Whomever GOD sends astray, nothing can guide him.

37.Rashad Khalifa: And whomever GOD guides, nothing can send him astray. Is GOD not Almighty, Avenger?

38.Rashad Khalifa: If you ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they will say, "GOD." Say, "Why then do you set up idols beside GOD? If GOD willed any adversity for me, can they relieve such an adversity? And if He willed a blessing for me, can they prevent such a blessing?" Say, "GOD is sufficient for me." In Him the trusters shall trust.

39.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "O my people, do your best and I will do my best; you will surely find out.

40.Rashad Khalifa: "(You will find out) who has incurred shameful punishment, and has deserved an eternal retribution."

41.Rashad Khalifa: We have revealed the scripture through you for the people, truthfully. Then, whoever is guided is guided for his own good, and whoever goes astray goes astray to his own detriment. You are not their advocate.

42.Rashad Khalifa: GOD puts the souls to death when the end of their life comes, and also at the time of sleep. Thus, He takes some back during their sleep, while others are allowed to continue living until the end of their predetermined interim. This should provide lessons for people who reflect.

43.Rashad Khalifa: Have they invented intercessors to mediate between them and GOD? Say, "What if they do not possess any power, nor understanding?"

44.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "All intercession belongs to GOD." To Him belongs all sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, then to Him you will be returned.

45.Rashad Khalifa: When GOD ALONE is mentioned, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter shrink with aversion. But when others are mentioned beside Him, they become satisfied.

46.Rashad Khalifa: Proclaim: "Our god, Initiator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of all secrets and declarations, You are the only One who judges among Your servants regarding their disputes."

47.Rashad Khalifa: If those who transgressed owned everything on earth, even twice as much, they would readily give it up to avoid the terrible retribution on the Day of Resurrection. They will be shown by GOD what they never expected.

48.Rashad Khalifa: The sinful works they had earned will be shown to them, and the very things they used to mock will come back to haunt them.

49.Rashad Khalifa: If the human is touched by adversity, he implores us, but as soon as we bestow a blessing upon him, he says, "I attained this because of my cleverness!" Indeed, this is only a test, but most of them do not know.

50.Rashad Khalifa: Those before them have uttered the same thing, and their earnings did not help them in the least.

51.Rashad Khalifa: They suffered the consequences of their evil works. Similarly, the transgressors among the present generation will suffer the consequences of their evil works; they cannot escape.

52.Rashad Khalifa: Do they not realize that GOD is the One who increases the provision for whomever He chooses, and withholds? These are lessons for people who believe.

53.Rashad Khalifa: Proclaim: "O My servants who exceeded the limits, never despair of GOD's mercy. For GOD forgives all sins. He is the Forgiver, Most Merciful."

54.Rashad Khalifa: You shall obey your Lord, and submit to Him totally, before the retribution overtakes you; then you cannot be helped.

55.Rashad Khalifa: And follow the best path that is pointed out for you by your Lord, before the retribution overtakes you suddenly when you least expect it.

56.Rashad Khalifa: Lest a soul may say, "How sorry I am for disregarding GOD's commandments; I was certainly one of the mockers."

57.Rashad Khalifa: Or say, "Had GOD guided me, I would have been with the righteous."

58.Rashad Khalifa: Or say, when it sees the retribution, "If I get another chance, I will work righteousness."

59.Rashad Khalifa: Yes indeed (you did get enough chances). My proofs came to you, but you rejected them, turned arrogant, and became a disbeliever.

60.Rashad Khalifa: On the Day of Resurrection you will see the faces of those who lied about GOD covered with misery. Is Hell not the right retribution for the arrogant ones?

61.Rashad Khalifa: And GOD will save those who have maintained righteousness; He will reward them. No harm will touch them, nor will they have any grief.

62.Rashad Khalifa: GOD is the Creator of all things, and He is in full control of all things.

63.Rashad Khalifa: To Him belongs all decisions in the heavens and the earth, and those who disbelieve in GOD's revelations are the real losers.

64.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "Is it other than GOD you exhort me to worship, O you ignorant ones?"

65.Rashad Khalifa: It has been revealed to you, and to those before you that if you ever commit idol worship, all your works will be nullified, and you will be with the losers.

66.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, you shall worship GOD alone, and be appreciative.

67.Rashad Khalifa: They can never fathom the greatness of GOD. The whole earth is within His fist on the Day of Resurrection. In fact, the universes are folded within His right hand. Be He glorified; He is much too high above needing any partners.

68.Rashad Khalifa: The horn will be blown, whereupon everyone in the heavens and the earth will be struck unconscious, except those who will be spared by GOD. Then it will be blown another time, whereupon they will all rise up, looking.

69.Rashad Khalifa: Then the earth will shine with the light of its Lord. The record will be proclaimed, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought forth. Everyone will then be judged equitably, without the least injustice.

70.Rashad Khalifa: Every soul will be paid for whatever it did, for He is fully aware of everything they have done.

71.Rashad Khalifa: Those who disbelieved will be led to Hell in throngs. When they get to it, and its gates are opened, its guards will say, "Did you not receive messengers from among you, who recited to you the revelations of your Lord, and warned you about meeting this day?" They will answer, "Yes indeed. But the word `retribution' was already stamped upon the disbelievers."

72.Rashad Khalifa: It will be said, "Enter the gates of Hell, wherein you abide forever." What a miserable destiny for the arrogant.

73.Rashad Khalifa: Those who reverenced their Lord will be led to Paradise in throngs. When they get to it, and its gates are opened, its guards will say, "Peace be upon you; you have won. Therefore, you abide herein forever."

74.Rashad Khalifa: They will say, "Praise be to GOD, who fulfilled His promise to us, and made us inherit the earth, enjoying Paradise as we please." What a beautiful recompense for the workers!

75.Rashad Khalifa: You will see the angels floating around the throne, glorifying and praising their Lord. After the equitable judgment is issued to all, it will be proclaimed: "Praise be to GOD, Lord of the universe."

1.Rashad Khalifa: H. M.

2.Rashad Khalifa: This revelation of the scripture is from GOD, the Almighty, the Omniscient.

3.Rashad Khalifa: Forgiver of sins, acceptor of repentance, strict in enforcing retribution, and possessor of all power. There is no other god beside Him. To Him is the ultimate destiny.

4.Rashad Khalifa: None argues against GOD's revelations except those who disbelieve. Do not be impressed by their apparent success.

5.Rashad Khalifa: Disbelieving before them were the people of Noah, and many other opponents after them. Every community persecuted their messenger to neutralize him. And they argued with falsehood, to defeat the truth. Consequently, I punished them; how terrible was My retribution

6.Rashad Khalifa: Thus, the judgment of your Lord is already stamped upon those who disbelieve, that they are the dwellers of Hell.

7.Rashad Khalifa: Those who serve the throne and all those around it glorify and praise their Lord, and believe in Him. And they ask forgiveness for those who believe: "Our Lord, Your mercy and Your knowledge encompass all things. Forgive those who repent and follow Your path, and spare them the retribution of Hell.

8.Rashad Khalifa: "Our Lord, and admit them into the gardens of Eden that You promised for them and for the righteous among their parents, spouses, and children. You are the Almighty, Most Wise.

9.Rashad Khalifa: "And protect them from falling in sin. Whomever You protect from falling in sin, on that day, has attained mercy from You. This is the greatest triumph."

10.Rashad Khalifa: Those who disbelieve will be told, "GOD's abhorrence towards you is even worse than your own abhorrence towards yourselves. For you were invited to believe, but you chose to disbelieve."

11.Rashad Khalifa: They will say, "Our Lord, you have put us to death twice, and You gave us two lives; now we have confessed our sins. Is there any way out?"

12.Rashad Khalifa: This is because when GOD ALONE was advocated, you disbelieved, but when others were mentioned beside Him, you believed. Therefore, GOD's judgment has been issued; He is the Most High, the Great.

13.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who continuously shows you His proofs, and sends down to you from the sky provisions. Only those who totally submit will be able to take heed.

14.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, you shall devote your worship absolutely to GOD ALONE, even if the disbelievers dislike it.

15.Rashad Khalifa: Possessor of the highest ranks, and Ruler of the whole dominion. He sends inspiration, bearing His commands, to whomever He chooses from among His servants, to warn about the Day of Summoning.

16.Rashad Khalifa: That is the day when everyone will be completely exposed; none of them will hide anything from GOD. To whom belongs all sovereignty on that day? To GOD, the One, the Supreme.

17.Rashad Khalifa: On that day, every soul will be requited for whatever it had earned. There will be no injustice on that day. GOD is most efficient in reckoning.

18.Rashad Khalifa: Warn them about the imminent day, when the hearts will be terrified, and many will be remorseful. The transgressors will have no friend nor an intercessor to be obeyed.

19.Rashad Khalifa: He is fully aware of what the eyes cannot see, and everything that the minds conceal.

20.Rashad Khalifa: GOD judges equitably, while the idols they implore beside Him cannot judge anything. GOD is the One who is the Hearer, the Seer.

21.Rashad Khalifa: Did they not roam the earth and note the consequences for those before them? They used to be stronger than they, and more productive on earth. But GOD punished them for their sins, and nothing could protect them from GOD.

22.Rashad Khalifa: That is because their messengers went to them with clear proofs, but they disbelieved. Consequently, GOD punished them. He is Mighty, strict in enforcing retribution.

23.Rashad Khalifa: We sent Moses with our signs and a profound authority.

24.Rashad Khalifa: To Pharaoh, Haamaan, and Qaaroon. But they said, "A magician; a liar."

25.Rashad Khalifa: And when he showed them the truth from us, they said, "Kill the sons of those who believed with him, and spare their daughters." Thus, the scheming of the disbelievers is always wicked.

26.Rashad Khalifa: Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses, and let him implore his Lord. I worry lest he corrupts your religion, or spreads evil throughout the land."

27.Rashad Khalifa: Moses said, "I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord, from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning."

28.Rashad Khalifa: A believing man among Pharaoh's people, who was concealing his belief, said, "How can you kill a man just for saying, `My Lord is GOD,' and he has shown you clear proofs from your Lord? If he is a liar, that is his problem, and if he is truthful, you benefit from his promises. Surely, GOD does not guide any transgressor, liar.

29.Rashad Khalifa: "O my people, today you have kingship and the upperhand. But who will help us against GOD's judgment, should it come to us?" Pharaoh said, "You are to follow only what I see fit; I will guide you only in the right path."

30.Rashad Khalifa: The one who believed said, "O my people, I fear for you the same fate as the previous opponents.

31.Rashad Khalifa: "The opponents of Noah, and `Aad, Thamoud, and others who came after them. GOD does not wish any injustice for the people.

32.Rashad Khalifa: "O my people, I fear for you the Day of Summoning.

33.Rashad Khalifa: "That is the day when you may wish to turn around and flee. But nothing will protect you then from GOD. Whomever GOD sends astray, nothing can guide him."

34.Rashad Khalifa: Joseph had come to you before that with clear revelations, but you continued to doubt his message. Then, when he died you said, "GOD will not send any other messenger after him. (He was the last messenger)!" GOD thus sends astray those who are transgressors, doubtful.

35.Rashad Khalifa: They argue against GOD's revelations, without any basis. This is a trait that is most abhorred by GOD and by those who believe. GOD thus seals the hearts of every arrogant tyrant.

36.Rashad Khalifa: Pharaoh said, "O Haamaan, build for me a high tower, that I may reach out and discover.

37.Rashad Khalifa: "I want to reach the heaven, and take a look at the god of Moses. I believe he is a liar." Thus were the evil works of Pharaoh adorned in his eyes, and thus was he kept from following (the right) path. Pharaoh's scheming was truly evil.

38.Rashad Khalifa: The one who believed said, "O my people, follow me, and I will guide you in the right way.

39.Rashad Khalifa: "O my people, this first life is a temporary illusion, while the Hereafter is the eternal abode."

40.Rashad Khalifa: Whoever commits a sin is requited for just that, and whoever works righteousness - male or female - while believing, these will enter Paradise wherein they receive provisions without any limits.

41.Rashad Khalifa: "O my people, while I invite you to be saved, you invite me to the hellfire.

42.Rashad Khalifa: "You invite me to be unappreciative of GOD, and to set up beside Him idols that I do not recognize. I am inviting you to the Almighty, the Forgiver.

43.Rashad Khalifa: "There is no doubt that what you invite me to do has no basis in this world, nor in the Hereafter, that our ultimate return is to GOD, and that the transgressors have incurred the hellfire.

44.Rashad Khalifa: "Some day you will remember what I am telling you now. I leave the judgment of this matter to GOD; GOD is the Seer of all the people."

45.Rashad Khalifa: GOD then protected him from their evil schemes, while the people of Pharaoh have incurred the worst retribution.

46.Rashad Khalifa: The Hell will be shown to them day and night, and on the Day of Resurrection: "Admit Pharaoh's people into the worst retribution."

47.Rashad Khalifa: As they argue in Hell, the followers will say to their leaders, "We used to be your followers, can you spare us any part of this Hell?"

48.Rashad Khalifa: The leaders will say, "We are all in this together. GOD has judged among the people."

49.Rashad Khalifa: Those in the hellfire will say to the guardians of Hell, "Call upon your Lord to reduce the retribution for us, for even one day."

50.Rashad Khalifa: They will say, "Did you not receive your messengers who delivered to you clear messages?" They will reply, "Yes we did." They will say, "Then implore (as much as you wish); the imploring of the disbelievers is always in vain."

51.Rashad Khalifa: Most assuredly, we will give victory to our messengers and to those who believe, both in this world and on the day the witnesses are summoned.

52.Rashad Khalifa: On that day, the apologies of the disbelievers will not benefit them. They have incurred condemnation; they have incurred the worst destiny.

53.Rashad Khalifa: We have given Moses the guidance, and made the Children of Israel inherit the scripture.

54.Rashad Khalifa: (Their history) is a lesson and a reminder for those who possess intelligence.

55.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, be patient, for GOD's promise is true, and ask forgiveness for your sin, and glorify and praise your Lord night and day.

56.Rashad Khalifa: Surely, those who argue against GOD's revelations without proof are exposing the arrogance that is hidden inside their chests, and they are not even aware of it. Therefore, seek refuge in GOD; He is the Hearer, the Seer.

57.Rashad Khalifa: The creation of the heavens and the earth is even more awesome than the creation of the human being, but most people do not know.

58.Rashad Khalifa: Not equal are the blind and the seer. Nor are those who believe and work righteousness equal to the sinners. Rarely do you take heed.

59.Rashad Khalifa: Most certainly, the Hour (Day of Judgment) is coming, no doubt about it, but most people do not believe.

60.Rashad Khalifa: Your Lord says, "Implore Me, and I will respond to you. Surely, those who are too arrogant to worship Me will enter Gehenna, forcibly."

61.Rashad Khalifa: GOD is the One who designed the night so you can rest in it, and the day lighted. GOD bestows many blessings upon the people, but most people are not thankful.

62.Rashad Khalifa: Such is GOD your Lord, the Creator of all things. There is no god except He. How could you deviate?

63.Rashad Khalifa: Deviating are those who disregard GOD's revelations.

64.Rashad Khalifa: GOD is the One who rendered the earth habitable for you, and the sky a formidable structure, and He designed you, and designed you well. He is the One who provides you with good provisions. Such is GOD your Lord; Most Exalted is GOD, Lord of the universe.

65.Rashad Khalifa: He is the Living; there is no god except He. You shall worship Him alone, devoting your religion absolutely to Him alone. Praise be to GOD, Lord of the universe.

66.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "I have been enjoined from worshiping the idols you worship beside GOD, when the clear revelations came to me from my Lord. I was commanded to submit to the Lord of the universe."

67.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who created you from dust, and subsequently from a tiny drop, then from a hanging embryo, then He brings you out as a child, then He lets you reach maturity, then you become old - some of you die earlier. You attain a predetermined age, that you may understand.

68.Rashad Khalifa: He is the only One who controls life and death. To have anything done, He simply says to it, "Be," and it is.

69.Rashad Khalifa: Have you noted those who argue against GOD's proofs, and how they have deviated?

70.Rashad Khalifa: They are the ones who have disbelieved in the scripture, and in the messages we have sent with our messengers. Therefore, they will surely find out.

71.Rashad Khalifa: The shackles will be around their necks, and the chains will be used to drag them.

72.Rashad Khalifa: In the Inferno, then in the Fire, they will burn.

73.Rashad Khalifa: They will be asked, "Where are the idols you used to worship,

74.Rashad Khalifa: "beside GOD?" They will say, "They have abandoned us. In fact, when we worshiped them, we were worshiping nothing." Thus does GOD send the disbelievers astray.

75.Rashad Khalifa: This is because you used to rejoice in false doctrines on earth, and you used to promote them.

76.Rashad Khalifa: Enter the gates of Gehenna, wherein you abide forever. What a miserable destiny for the arrogant ones.

77.Rashad Khalifa: You shall be patient, for GOD's promise is truth. Whether we show you some of (the retribution) we have promised for them, or terminate your life before that, they will be returned to us.

78.Rashad Khalifa: We have sent messengers before you - some of them we mentioned to you, and some we did not mention to you. No messenger can produce any miracle without GOD's authorization. Once GOD's judgment is issued, the truth dominates, and the falsifiers are exposed and humiliated.

79.Rashad Khalifa: GOD is the One who created the livestock for you; some you ride, and some you eat.

80.Rashad Khalifa: They also provide you with additional benefits that satisfy many of your needs. On them, as well as on the ships, you are carried.

81.Rashad Khalifa: He thus shows you His proofs. Which of GOD's proofs can you deny?

82.Rashad Khalifa: Have they not roamed the earth and noted the consequences for those who preceded them? They used to be greater in number, greater in power, and possessed a greater legacy on earth. Yet, all their achievements did not help them in the least.

83.Rashad Khalifa: When their messengers went to them with clear proofs, they rejoiced in the knowledge they had inherited, and the very things they ridiculed were the cause of their fall.

84.Rashad Khalifa: Subsequently, when they saw our retribution they said, "Now we believe in GOD ALONE, and we now disbelieve in the idol worship that we used to practice."

85.Rashad Khalifa: Their belief then could not help them in the least, once they saw our retribution. Such is GOD's system that has been established to deal with His creatures; the disbelievers are always doomed.

41.SurahEnglishNames: Explained in Detail, Revelations Well Expounded

1.Rashad Khalifa: H. M.

2.Rashad Khalifa: A revelation from the Most Gracious, Most Merciful.

3.Rashad Khalifa: A scripture whose verses provide the complete details, in an Arabic Quran, for people who know.

4.Rashad Khalifa: A bearer of good news, as well as a warner. However, most of them turn away; they do not hear.

5.Rashad Khalifa: They said, "Our minds are made up, our ears are deaf to your message, and a barrier separates us from you. Do what you want, and so will we."

6.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "I am no more than a human being like you, who has been inspired that your god is one god. You shall be devoted to Him, and ask His forgiveness. Woe to the idol worshipers.

7.Rashad Khalifa: "Who do not give the obligatory charity (Zakat), and with regard to the Hereafter, they are disbelievers."

8.Rashad Khalifa: As for those who believe and lead a righteous life, they receive a well deserved recompense.

9.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "You disbelieve in the One who created the earth in two days, and you set up idols to rank with Him, though He is Lord of the universe."

10.Rashad Khalifa: He placed on it stabilizers (mountains), made it productive, and He calculated its provisions in four days, to satisfy the needs of all its inhabitants.

11.Rashad Khalifa: Then He turned to the sky, when it was still gas, and said to it, and to the earth, "Come into existence, willingly or unwillingly." They said, "We come willingly."

12.Rashad Khalifa: Thus, He completed the seven universes in two days, and set up the laws for every universe. And we adorned the lowest universe with lamps, and placed guards around it. Such is the design of the Almighty, the Omniscient.

13.Rashad Khalifa: If they turn away, then say, "I am warning you of a disaster like the disaster that annihilated `Aad and Thamoud."

14.Rashad Khalifa: Their messengers went to them, as well as before them and after them, saying, "You shall not worship except GOD." They said, "Had our Lord willed, He could have sent angels. We are disbelievers in what you say."

15.Rashad Khalifa: As for `Aad, they turned arrogant on earth, opposed the truth, and said, "Who is more powerful than we?" Did they not realize that GOD, who created them, is more powerful than they? They were unappreciative of our revelations.

16.Rashad Khalifa: Consequently, we sent upon them violent wind, for a few miserable days. We thus afflicted them with humiliating retribution in this life, and the retribution of the Hereafter is more humiliating; they can never win.

17.Rashad Khalifa: As for Thamoud, we provided them with guidance, but they preferred blindness over guidance. Consequently, the disastrous and shameful retribution annihilated them, because of what they earned.

18.Rashad Khalifa: We always save those who believe and lead a righteous life.

19.Rashad Khalifa: The day will come when the enemies of GOD will be summoned to the hellfire, forcibly.

20.Rashad Khalifa: Once they get there, their own hearing, eyes, and skins will bear witness to everything they had done.

21.Rashad Khalifa: They will say to their skins, "Why did you bear witness against us?" They will reply, "GOD made us speak up; He is the One who causes everything to speak. He is the One who created you the first time, and now you have been returned to Him."

22.Rashad Khalifa: There is no way you can hide from your own hearing, your eyes, or your skins. In fact, you thought that GOD was unaware of much of what you do.

23.Rashad Khalifa: This kind of thinking about your Lord will cause you to fall, and then you become losers.

24.Rashad Khalifa: If they continue the way they are, Hell will be their destiny, and if they make up excuses, they will not be excused.

25.Rashad Khalifa: We assign to them companions who adorn everything they do in their eyes. Thus, they end up incurring the same fate as the previous communities of jinns and humans, who were also losers.

26.Rashad Khalifa: Those who disbelieved said, "Do not listen to this Quran and distort it, that you may win."

27.Rashad Khalifa: We will certainly afflict these disbelievers with a severe retribution. We will certainly requite them for their evil works.

28.Rashad Khalifa: Such is the requital that awaits GOD's enemies. Hell will be their eternal abode; a just requital for discarding our revelations.

29.Rashad Khalifa: Those who disbelieved will say, "Our Lord, show us those among the two kinds - jinns and humans - who misled us, so we can trample them under our feet, and render them the lowliest."

30.Rashad Khalifa: Those who proclaim: "Our Lord is GOD," then lead a righteous life, the angels descend upon them: "You shall have no fear, nor shall you grieve. Rejoice in the good news that Paradise has been reserved for you.

31.Rashad Khalifa: "We are your allies in this life, and in the Hereafter. You will have in it anything you wish for; you will have anything you want.

32.Rashad Khalifa: "(Such is your) ultimate abode, from a Forgiver, Most Merciful."

33.Rashad Khalifa: Who can utter better words than one who invites to GOD, works righteousness, and says, "I am one of the submitters"?

34.Rashad Khalifa: Not equal is the good response and the bad response. You shall resort to the nicest possible response. Thus, the one who used to be your enemy, may become your best friend.

35.Rashad Khalifa: None can attain this except those who steadfastly persevere. None can attain this except those who are extremely fortunate.

36.Rashad Khalifa: When the devil whispers an idea to you, you shall seek refuge in GOD. He is the Hearer, the Omniscient.

37.Rashad Khalifa: Among His proofs are the night and the day, and the sun and the moon. Do not prostrate before the sun, nor the moon; you shall fall prostrate before the GOD who created them, if you truly worship Him alone.

38.Rashad Khalifa: If they are too arrogant to do this, then those at your Lord glorify Him night and day, without ever tiring.

39.Rashad Khalifa: Among His proofs is that you see the land still, then, as soon as we shower it with water, it vibrates with life. Surely, the One who revived it can revive the dead. He is Omnipotent.

40.Rashad Khalifa: Surely, those who distort our revelations are not hidden from us. Is one who gets thrown into Hell better, or one who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection? Do whatever you wish; He is Seer of everything you do.

41.Rashad Khalifa: Those who have rejected the Quran's proof when it came to them, have also rejected an Honorable book.

42.Rashad Khalifa: No falsehood could enter it, in the past or in the future; a revelation from a Most Wise, Praiseworthy.

43.Rashad Khalifa: What is said to you is precisely what was said to the previous messengers. Your Lord possesses forgiveness, and He also possesses painful retribution.

44.Rashad Khalifa: If we made it a non-Arabic Quran they would have said, "Why did it come down in that language?" Whether it is Arabic or non-Arabic, say, "For those who believe, it is a guide and healing. As for those who disbelieve, they will be deaf and blind to it, as if they are being addressed from faraway."

45.Rashad Khalifa: We have given Moses the scripture and it was also disputed. If it were not for your Lord's predetermined decision, they would have been judged immediately. Indeed, they harbor too many doubts.

46.Rashad Khalifa: Whoever works righteousness does so for his own good, and whoever works evil does so to his own detriment. Your Lord is never unjust towards the people.

47.Rashad Khalifa: With Him is the knowledge about the Hour (end of the world). No fruits emerge from their sheaths, nor does any female conceive or give birth, without His knowledge. The day will come when He asks them: "Where are those idols that you set up beside Me?" They will say, "We proclaim to You that none of us bears witness to that."

48.Rashad Khalifa: The idols they had idolized will disown them, and they will realize that there will be no escape.

49.Rashad Khalifa: The human being never tires of imploring for good things. And when adversity befalls him, he turns despondent, desperate.

50.Rashad Khalifa: And when we bless him after suffering some adversity, he says, "This belongs to me. I do not believe that the Hour will ever come to pass. Even if I am returned to my Lord, I will find at Him better things." Most certainly, we will inform the disbelievers of all their works, and will commit them to severe retribution.

51.Rashad Khalifa: When we bless the human being, he turns away, and drifts farther and farther away, and when he suffers any affliction, he implores loudly.

52.Rashad Khalifa: Proclaim: "What if this is truly from GOD, then you decide to reject it? Who are farther astray than those who decide to oppose this?"

53.Rashad Khalifa: We will show them our proofs in the horizons, and within themselves, until they realize that this is the truth. Is your Lord not sufficient as a witness of all things?

54.Rashad Khalifa: Indeed, they are doubtful about meeting their Lord. He is fully aware of all things.

1.Rashad Khalifa: H. M.

2.Rashad Khalifa: `A. S. Q.

3.Rashad Khalifa: Inspiring you, and those before you, is GOD, the Almighty, Most Wise.

4.Rashad Khalifa: To Him belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth, and He is the Most High, the Great.

5.Rashad Khalifa: The heavens above them almost shatter, out of reverence for Him, and the angels praise and glorify their Lord, and they ask forgiveness for those on earth. Absolutely, GOD is the Forgiver, Most Merciful.

6.Rashad Khalifa: Those who set up other lords beside Him, GOD is the One in charge of them; you are not their advocate.

7.Rashad Khalifa: We thus reveal to you an Arabic Quran to warn the central community and all around it, and to warn about the Day of Summoning that is inevitable. Some will end up in Heaven, and some in Hell.

8.Rashad Khalifa: Had GOD willed, He could have made them one community. But He redeems into His mercy whomever He wills. As for the transgressors, they have no master, nor a helper.

9.Rashad Khalifa: Did they find other lords beside Him? GOD is the only Lord and Master. He is the One who resurrects the dead, and He is the Omnipotent One.

10.Rashad Khalifa: If you dispute any part of this message, the judgment for doing this rests with GOD. Such is GOD my Lord. In Him I trust, and to Him I submit.

11.Rashad Khalifa: Initiator of the heavens and the earth. He created for you from among yourselves spouses - and also for the animals. He thus provides you with the means to multiply. There is nothing that equals Him. He is the Hearer, the Seer.

12.Rashad Khalifa: To Him belongs absolute control of the heavens and the earth. He is the One who increases the provision for whomever He wills, or reduces it. He is fully aware of all things.

13.Rashad Khalifa: He decreed for you the same religion decreed for Noah, and what we inspired to you, and what we decreed for Abraham, Moses, and Jesus: "You shall uphold this one religion, and do not divide it." The idol worshipers will greatly resent what you invite them to do. GOD redeems to Himself whomever He wills; He guides to Himself only those who totally submit.

14.Rashad Khalifa: Ironically, they broke up into sects only after the knowledge had come to them, due to jealousy and resentment among themselves. If it were not for a predetermined decision from your Lord to respite them for a definite interim, they would have been judged immediately. Indeed, the later generations who inherited the scripture are full of doubts.

15.Rashad Khalifa: This is what you shall preach, and steadfastly maintain what you are commanded to do, and do not follow their wishes. And proclaim: "I believe in all the scriptures sent down by GOD. I was commanded to judge among you equitably. GOD is our Lord and your Lord. We have our deeds and you have your deeds. There is no argument between us and you. GOD will gather us all together; to Him is the ultimate destiny."

16.Rashad Khalifa: Those who argue about GOD, after receiving His message, their argument is nullified at their Lord. They have incurred condemnation, and have deserved a severe retribution.

17.Rashad Khalifa: GOD is the One who sent down the scripture, to deliver the truth and the law. For all that you know, the Hour (Day of Judgment) may be very close.

18.Rashad Khalifa: Challenging it are those who do not believe in it. As for those who believe, they are concerned about it, and they know that it is the truth. Absolutely, those who deny the Hour have gone far astray.

19.Rashad Khalifa: GOD is fully aware of all His creatures; He provides for whomever He wills. He is the Powerful, the Almighty.

20.Rashad Khalifa: Whoever seeks the rewards of the Hereafter, we multiply the rewards for him. And whoever seeks the materials of this world, we give him therefrom, then he receives no share in the Hereafter.

21.Rashad Khalifa: They follow idols who decree for them religious laws never authorized by GOD. If it were not for the predetermined decision, they would have been judged immediately. Indeed, the transgressors have incurred a painful retribution.

22.Rashad Khalifa: You will see the transgressors worried about everything they had committed; everything will come back and haunt them. As for those who believed and led a righteous life, they will be in the gardens of Paradise. They will receive whatever they wish from their Lord. This is the great blessing.

23.Rashad Khalifa: This is the good news from GOD to His servants who believe and lead a righteous life. Say, "I do not ask you for any wage. I do ask each of you to take care of your own relatives." Anyone who does a righteous work, we multiply his reward for it. GOD is Forgiver, Appreciative.

24.Rashad Khalifa: Are they saying, "He (Rashad) has fabricated lies about GOD!"? If GOD willed, He could have sealed your mind, but GOD erases the falsehood and affirms the truth with His words. He is fully aware of the innermost thoughts.

25.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who accepts the repentance from His servants, and remits the sins. He is fully aware of everything you do.

26.Rashad Khalifa: Responding to Him are those who believe and lead a righteous life. He will shower them with His blessings. As for the disbelievers, they have incurred a severe retribution.

27.Rashad Khalifa: If GOD increased the provision for His servants, they would transgress on earth. This is why He sends it precisely measured to whomever He wills. He is fully Cognizant and Seer of His servants.

28.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who sends down the rain after they had despaired, and spreads His mercy. He is the only Master, Most Praiseworthy.

29.Rashad Khalifa: Among His proofs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the creatures He spreads in them. He is able to summon them, when He wills.

30.Rashad Khalifa: Anything bad that happens to you is a consequence of your own deeds, and He overlooks many (of your sins).

31.Rashad Khalifa: You can never escape, and you have none beside GOD as a Lord and Master.

32.Rashad Khalifa: Among His proofs are the ships that sail the sea with sails like flags.

33.Rashad Khalifa: If He willed, He could have stilled the winds, leaving them motionless on top of the water. These are proofs for those who are steadfast, appreciative.

34.Rashad Khalifa: He can annihilate them, as a consequence of their own works. Instead, He overlooks many (of their sins).

35.Rashad Khalifa: Those who argue against our proofs will find out that they have no basis.

36.Rashad Khalifa: Whatever you are given is no more than temporary material of this life. What GOD possesses is far better and everlasting, for those who believe and trust in their Lord.

37.Rashad Khalifa: They avoid gross sins and vice, and when angered they forgive.

38.Rashad Khalifa: They respond to their Lord by observing the Contact Prayers (Salat). Their affairs are decided after due consultation among themselves, and from our provisions to them they give (to charity).

39.Rashad Khalifa: When gross injustice befalls them, they stand up for their rights.

40.Rashad Khalifa: Although the just requital for an injustice is an equivalent retribution, those who pardon and maintain righteousness are rewarded by GOD. He does not love the unjust.

41.Rashad Khalifa: Certainly, those who stand up for their rights, when injustice befalls them, are not committing any error.

42.Rashad Khalifa: The wrong ones are those who treat the people unjustly, and resort to aggression without provocation. These have incurred a painful retribution.

43.Rashad Khalifa: Resorting to patience and forgiveness reflects a true strength of character.

44.Rashad Khalifa: Whomever GOD sends astray will never find any other lord, and you will see such transgressors, when they see the retribution, saying, "Can we get another chance?"

45.Rashad Khalifa: You will see them facing it, humiliated and debased, and looking, yet trying to avoid looking. Those who believed will proclaim: "The real losers are those who lost their souls and their families on the Day of Resurrection. The transgressors have deserved an everlasting retribution."

46.Rashad Khalifa: There will be no allies to help them against GOD. Whomever GOD sends astray can never be guided

47.Rashad Khalifa: You shall respond to your Lord before a day comes which is decreed inevitable by GOD. There will be no refuge for you on that day, nor an advocate.

48.Rashad Khalifa: If they turn away, we did not send you as their guardian. Your sole mission is delivering the message. When we shower the human beings with mercy, they become proud, and when adversity afflicts them, as a consequence of their own deeds, the human beings turn into disbelievers.

49.Rashad Khalifa: To GOD belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. He creates whatever He wills, granting daughters to whomever He wills, and granting sons to whomever He wills.

50.Rashad Khalifa: Or, He may have the males and the females marry each other, then render whomever He wills sterile. He is Omniscient, Omnipotent.

51.Rashad Khalifa: No human being can communicate with GOD except through inspiration, or from behind a barrier, or by sending a messenger through whom He reveals what He wills. He is the Most High, Most Wise.

52.Rashad Khalifa: Thus, we inspired to you a revelation proclaiming our commandments. You had no idea about the scripture, or faith. Yet, we made this a beacon to guide whomever we choose from among our servants. Surely, you guide in a straight path.

53.Rashad Khalifa: The path of GOD, to whom belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth. Absolutely, all matters are controlled by GOD.

43.SurahEnglishNames: Ornaments of Gold, Luxury, The Embellishment

1.Rashad Khalifa: H. M.

2.Rashad Khalifa: And the enlightening scripture.

3.Rashad Khalifa: We have rendered it an Arabic Quran, that you may understand.

4.Rashad Khalifa: It is preserved with us in the original master, honorable and full of wisdom.

5.Rashad Khalifa: Should we just ignore the fact that you have transgressed the limits?

6.Rashad Khalifa: We have sent many a prophet to the previous generations.

7.Rashad Khalifa: Every time a prophet went to them, they ridiculed him.

8.Rashad Khalifa: Consequently, we annihilated people who were even more powerful than these. We thus set the examples from the previous communities.

9.Rashad Khalifa: If you asked them, "Who created the heavens and the earth," they would say, "The Almighty, the Omniscient has created them."

10.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who made the earth habitable for you, and created for you roads therein, that you may follow the right way.

11.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who sends down from the sky water, in exact measure, to revive dead lands therewith. Similarly, you will be resurrected.

12.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who created all kinds, in pairs (male and female), and He created for you ships and livestock to ride.

13.Rashad Khalifa: As you rest on top of them, you shall appreciate such a blessing from your Lord, and say, "Glory be to the One who subdued this for us. We could not have controlled them by ourselves.

14.Rashad Khalifa: "We ultimately return to our Lord."

15.Rashad Khalifa: They even assigned for Him a share from His own creation! Surely, the human being is profoundly unappreciative.

16.Rashad Khalifa: Has He chosen from among His creations daughters for Himself, while blessing you with sons?

17.Rashad Khalifa: When one of them is given news (of a daughter) as they claimed for the Most Gracious, his face is darkened with misery and anger!

18.Rashad Khalifa: (They say,) "What is good about an offspring that is brought up to be beautiful, and cannot help in war?"

19.Rashad Khalifa: They claimed that the angels, who are servants of the Most Gracious, are females! Have they witnessed their creation? Their claims are recorded, and they will be asked.

20.Rashad Khalifa: They even said, "If the Most Gracious willed, we would not have worshiped them." They have no basis for such a claim; they only conjecture.

21.Rashad Khalifa: Have we given them a book before this, and they are upholding it?

22.Rashad Khalifa: The fact is that: they said, "We found our parents carrying on certain practices, and we are following in their footsteps."

23.Rashad Khalifa: Invariably, when we sent a warner to any community, the leaders of that community would say, "We found our parents following certain practices, and we will continue in their footsteps."

24.Rashad Khalifa: (The messenger) would say, "What if I brought to you better guidance than what you inherited from your parents?" They would say, "We are disbelievers in the message you brought."

25.Rashad Khalifa: Consequently, we requited them. Note the consequences for the rejectors.

26.Rashad Khalifa: Abraham said to his father and his people, "I disown what you worship.

27.Rashad Khalifa: "Only the One who initiated me can guide me."

28.Rashad Khalifa: This example (of Abraham) was rendered an everlasting lesson for subsequent generations; perhaps they redeem their souls.

29.Rashad Khalifa: Indeed, I have given these people and their ancestors sufficient chances, then the truth came to them, and a clarifying messenger.

30.Rashad Khalifa: When the truth came to them, they said, "This is magic, and we are disbelievers therein."

31.Rashad Khalifa: They said, "If only this Quran was sent down through another man from the two communities (Mecca or Yathrib) who is prominent!"

32.Rashad Khalifa: Are they the ones who assign your Lord's mercy? We have assigned their shares in this life, raising some of them above others in ranks, in order to let them serve one another. The mercy from your Lord is far better than any material they may hoard.

33.Rashad Khalifa: If it were not that all the people might become one (disbelieving) congregation, we would have granted everyone who disbelieves in the Most Gracious mansions with silver roofs, and stairs upon which they could climb.

34.Rashad Khalifa: Their mansions would have impressive gates, and luxurious furnishings.

35.Rashad Khalifa: Also many ornaments. All these are the temporary materials of this lowly life. The Hereafter - at your Lord - is far better for the righteous.

36.Rashad Khalifa: Anyone who disregards the message of the Most Gracious, we appoint a devil to be his constant companion.

37.Rashad Khalifa: Such companions will divert them from the path, yet make them believe that they are guided.

38.Rashad Khalifa: When he comes before us he will say, "Oh I wish you were as far from me as the two easts. What a miserable companion!"

39.Rashad Khalifa: It will not console you on that day, as transgressors, that both of you will share in the retribution.

40.Rashad Khalifa: Can you make the deaf hear; can you make the blind see, or those who are far astray?

41.Rashad Khalifa: Whether we let you die before it or not, we will surely requite them.

42.Rashad Khalifa: Or, we may show you (the retribution) we promised for them. We are in full control over them.

43.Rashad Khalifa: You shall steadfastly preach what is revealed to you; you are in the right path.

44.Rashad Khalifa: This is a message for you and your people; all of you will be questioned.

45.Rashad Khalifa: Check the messengers we sent before you: "Have we ever appointed any other gods - beside the Most Gracious - to be worshiped?"

46.Rashad Khalifa: For example, we sent Moses with our proofs to Pharaoh and his elders, proclaiming: "I am a messenger from the Lord of the universe."

47.Rashad Khalifa: When he showed them our proofs, they laughed at them.

48.Rashad Khalifa: Every sign we showed them was bigger than the one before it. We afflicted them with the plagues, perhaps they repent.

49.Rashad Khalifa: They said, "O you magician, implore your Lord on our behalf (to relieve this plague), since you have an agreement with Him; we will then be guided."

50.Rashad Khalifa: But as soon as we relieved their affliction, they reverted.

51.Rashad Khalifa: Pharaoh announced to his people, "O my people, do I not possess the kingship over Egypt, and these flowing rivers belong to me? Do you not see?

52.Rashad Khalifa: "Which one is better; me or that one who is lowly and can hardly speak?

53.Rashad Khalifa: "How come he does not possess a treasure of gold; how come the angels do not accompany him?"

54.Rashad Khalifa: He thus fooled his people, and they obeyed him; they were wicked people.

55.Rashad Khalifa: When they persisted in opposing us, we punished them and drowned them all.

56.Rashad Khalifa: We rendered them a precedent and an example for the others.

57.Rashad Khalifa: When the son of Mary was cited as an example, your people disregarded it.

58.Rashad Khalifa: They said, "Is it better to worship our gods, or to worship him?" They said this only to argue with you. Indeed, they are people who have joined the opposition.

59.Rashad Khalifa: He was no more than a servant whom we blessed, and we sent him as an example for the Children of Israel.

60.Rashad Khalifa: If we willed, we could have made you angels who colonize and reproduce on earth.

61.Rashad Khalifa: He is to serve as a marker for knowing the end of the world, so you can no longer harbor any doubt about it. You shall follow Me; this is the right path.

62.Rashad Khalifa: Let not the devil repel you; he is your most ardent enemy.

63.Rashad Khalifa: When Jesus went with the proofs, he said, "I bring to you wisdom, and to clarify some of the matters in which you dispute. You shall reverence GOD and obey me.

64.Rashad Khalifa: "GOD is my Lord and your Lord, you shall worship Him alone. This is the right path."

65.Rashad Khalifa: The opponents disputed among themselves. Woe to those who transgress from the retribution of a painful day.

66.Rashad Khalifa: Are they waiting for the Hour (Day of Judgment) to come to them suddenly when they least expect it?

67.Rashad Khalifa: The close friends on that day will become enemies of one another, except for the righteous.

68.Rashad Khalifa: O My servants, you will have no fear on that day, nor will you grieve.

69.Rashad Khalifa: They are the ones who believed in our revelations, and were submitters.

70.Rashad Khalifa: Enter Paradise, together with your spouses, and rejoice.

71.Rashad Khalifa: Offered to them will be golden trays and cups, and they will find everything the hearts desire and the eyes wish for. You live therein forever.

72.Rashad Khalifa: Such is the Paradise that you inherit, in return for your works.

73.Rashad Khalifa: You will have in it all kinds of fruits, from which you eat.

74.Rashad Khalifa: Surely, the guilty will abide in the retribution of Gehenna forever.

75.Rashad Khalifa: Never will the retribution be commuted for them; they will be confined therein.

76.Rashad Khalifa: It is not us who wronged them; it is they who wronged their own souls.

77.Rashad Khalifa: They will implore: "O Maalek, let your Lord finish us off." He will say, "You are staying forever.

78.Rashad Khalifa: "We have given you the truth, but most of you hate the truth."

79.Rashad Khalifa: Have they schemed some scheme? We too are scheming.

80.Rashad Khalifa: Do they think that we do not hear their secrets and conspiracies? Yes indeed; our messengers are with them, recording.

81.Rashad Khalifa: Proclaim: "If the Most Gracious did have a son, I would still be the foremost worshiper."

82.Rashad Khalifa: Be He glorified; He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord with the great dominion, far above their claims.

83.Rashad Khalifa: Let them blunder and play until they meet their day that is awaiting them.

84.Rashad Khalifa: He is the only One who is a deity in the heaven and a deity on earth. He is the Most Wise, the Omniscient.

85.Rashad Khalifa: Most Exalted is the One who possesses all sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them. With Him is the knowledge about the Hour (end of the world), and to Him you will be returned.

86.Rashad Khalifa: None of those whom they idolize beside Him possess any power to intercede, unless their intercession coincides with the truth, and they fully know.

87.Rashad Khalifa: If you asked them who created them, they would say, "GOD." Why then did they deviate?

88.Rashad Khalifa: It will be proclaimed: "O my Lord, these people do not believe."

89.Rashad Khalifa: You shall disregard them and say, "Peace;" they will surely find out.

1.Rashad Khalifa: H. M.

2.Rashad Khalifa: And this enlightening scripture.

3.Rashad Khalifa: We have sent it down in a blessed night, for we are to warn.

4.Rashad Khalifa: In it (the scripture), every matter of wisdom is clarified.

5.Rashad Khalifa: It is a predetermined command from us that we send messengers.

6.Rashad Khalifa: This is a mercy from your Lord. He is the Hearer, the Omniscient.

7.Rashad Khalifa: Lord of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them. If only you could be certain!

8.Rashad Khalifa: There is no other god beside Him. He controls life and death; your Lord and the Lord of your ancestors.

9.Rashad Khalifa: Indeed, they are doubtful, heedless.

10.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, watch for the day when the sky brings a profound smoke.

11.Rashad Khalifa: It will envelope the people; this is a painful retribution.

12.Rashad Khalifa: "Our Lord, relieve this retribution for us; we are believers."

13.Rashad Khalifa: Now that it is too late, they remember! An enlightening messenger had come to them.

14.Rashad Khalifa: But they turned away from him, saying, "Well educated, but crazy!"

15.Rashad Khalifa: We will relieve the retribution for awhile; you will soon revert.

16.Rashad Khalifa: The day we strike the big stroke, we will avenge.

17.Rashad Khalifa: We have tested before them the people of Pharaoh; an honorable messenger went to them.

18.Rashad Khalifa: Proclaiming: "Listen to me, servants of GOD. I am an honest messenger to you."

19.Rashad Khalifa: And, "Do not transgress against GOD. I bring to you powerful proofs.

20.Rashad Khalifa: "I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord, if you oppose me.

21.Rashad Khalifa: "If you do not wish to believe, then simply leave me alone."

22.Rashad Khalifa: Subsequently, he implored his Lord: "These are wicked people."

23.Rashad Khalifa: (God said,) "Travel with My servants during the night; you will be pursued.

24.Rashad Khalifa: "Cross the sea quickly; their troops will be drowned."

25.Rashad Khalifa: Thus, they left behind many gardens and springs.

26.Rashad Khalifa: Crops and a luxurious life.

27.Rashad Khalifa: Blessings that they enjoyed.

28.Rashad Khalifa: All these we caused to be inherited by other people.

29.Rashad Khalifa: Neither the heaven, nor the earth wept over them, and they were not respited.

30.Rashad Khalifa: Meanwhile, we saved the Children of Israel from the humiliating persecution.

31.Rashad Khalifa: From Pharaoh; he was a tyrant.

32.Rashad Khalifa: We have chosen them from among all the people, knowingly.

33.Rashad Khalifa: We showed them so many proofs, which constituted a great test.

34.Rashad Khalifa: The present generations say,

35.Rashad Khalifa: "We only die the first death; we will never be resurrected!

36.Rashad Khalifa: "Bring back our forefathers, if you are truthful."

37.Rashad Khalifa: Are they better than the people of Tubba` and others before them? We annihilated them for their crimes.

38.Rashad Khalifa: We did not create the heavens and the earth, and everything between them, just to play.

39.Rashad Khalifa: We created them for a specific purpose, but most of them do not know.

40.Rashad Khalifa: The Day of Decision awaits them all.

41.Rashad Khalifa: That is the day when no friend can help his friend in any way; no one can be helped.

42.Rashad Khalifa: Only those who attain mercy from GOD. He is the Almighty, Most Merciful.

43.Rashad Khalifa: Surely, the tree of bitterness -

44.Rashad Khalifa: will provide the food for the sinful.

45.Rashad Khalifa: Like lye, it will boil in the stomachs.

46.Rashad Khalifa: Like the boiling of hellish drinks.

47.Rashad Khalifa: Take him and throw him into the center of Hell.

48.Rashad Khalifa: Then pour upon his head the retribution of the Inferno.

49.Rashad Khalifa: "Taste this; you were so powerful, so honorable."

50.Rashad Khalifa: This is what you used to doubt.

51.Rashad Khalifa: The righteous will be in a secure position.

52.Rashad Khalifa: Enjoying gardens and springs.

53.Rashad Khalifa: Wearing velvet and satin; close to each other.

54.Rashad Khalifa: We grant them wonderful spouses.

55.Rashad Khalifa: They enjoy in it all kinds of fruits, in perfect peace.

56.Rashad Khalifa: They do not taste death therein - beyond the first death - and He has spared them the retribution of Hell.

57.Rashad Khalifa: Such is the blessing from your Lord. Such is the great triumph.

58.Rashad Khalifa: We have thus clarified it in your language, that they may take heed.

59.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, wait; they too will have to wait

1.Rashad Khalifa: H. M.

2.Rashad Khalifa: The revelation of this scripture is from GOD, the Almighty, Most Wise.

3.Rashad Khalifa: The heavens and the earth are full of proofs for the believers.

4.Rashad Khalifa: Also in your creation, and the creation of all the animals, there are proofs for people who are certain.

5.Rashad Khalifa: Also, the alternation of the night and the day, and the provisions that GOD sends down from the sky to revive dead lands, and the manipulation of the winds; all these are proofs for people who understand.

6.Rashad Khalifa: These are GOD's revelations that we recite to you truthfully. In which Hadith other than GOD and His revelations do they believe?

7.Rashad Khalifa: Woe to every fabricator, guilty.

8.Rashad Khalifa: The one who hears GOD's revelations recited to him, then insists arrogantly on his way, as if he never heard them. Promise him a painful retribution.

9.Rashad Khalifa: When he learns anything about our revelations, he mocks them. These have incurred a shameful retribution.

10.Rashad Khalifa: Awaiting them is Gehenna. Their earnings will not help them, nor the idols they had set up beside GOD. They have incurred a terrible retribution.

11.Rashad Khalifa: This is a beacon, and those who disbelieve in these revelations of their Lord have incurred condemnation and a painful retribution.

12.Rashad Khalifa: GOD is the One who committed the sea in your service, so that the ships can roam it in accordance with His laws. You thus seek His provisions, that you may be appreciative.

13.Rashad Khalifa: He committed in your service everything in the heavens and the earth; all from Him. These are proofs for people who reflect.

14.Rashad Khalifa: Tell those who believed to forgive those who do not expect the days of GOD. He will fully pay everyone for whatever they have earned.

15.Rashad Khalifa: Whoever works righteousness does so for his own good, and whoever works evil does so to his own detriment. To your Lord you will be returned.

16.Rashad Khalifa: We have given the Children of Israel the scripture, wisdom, and prophethood, and provided them with good provisions; we bestowed upon them more blessings than any other people.

17.Rashad Khalifa: We have given them herein clear commandments. Ironically, they did not dispute this until the knowledge had come to them. This is due to jealousy on their part. Surely, your Lord will judge them on the Day of Resurrection regarding everything they have disputed.

18.Rashad Khalifa: We then appointed you to establish the correct laws; you shall follow this, and do not follow the wishes of those who do not know.

19.Rashad Khalifa: They cannot help you at all against GOD. It is the transgressors who ally themselves with one another, while GOD is the Lord of the righteous.

20.Rashad Khalifa: This provides enlightenments for the people, and guidance, and mercy for those who are certain.

21.Rashad Khalifa: Do those who work evil expect that we will treat them in the same manner as those who believe and lead a righteous life? Can their life and their death be the same? Wrong indeed is their judgment.

22.Rashad Khalifa: GOD created the heavens and the earth for a specific purpose, in order to pay each soul for whatever it earned, without the least injustice.

23.Rashad Khalifa: Have you noted the one whose god is his ego? Consequently, GOD sends him astray, despite his knowledge, seals his hearing and his mind, and places a veil on his eyes. Who then can guide him, after such a decision by GOD? Would you not take heed?

24.Rashad Khalifa: They said, "We only live this life; we live and die and only time causes our death!" They have no sure knowledge about this; they only conjecture.

25.Rashad Khalifa: When our revelations are recited to them, clearly, their only argument is to say, "Bring back our forefathers, if you are truthful."

26.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "GOD has granted you life, then He puts you to death, then He will summon you to the Day of Resurrection, which is inevitable. But most people do not know."

27.Rashad Khalifa: To GOD belongs all sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. The day the Hour (Judgment) comes to pass, that is when the falsifiers lose.

28.Rashad Khalifa: You will see every community kneeling. Every community will be called to view their record. Today, you get paid for everything you have done.

29.Rashad Khalifa: This is our record; it utters the truth about you. We have been recording everything you did.

30.Rashad Khalifa: As for those who believe and work righteousness, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. This is the great triumph.

31.Rashad Khalifa: As for those who disbelieve: "Were not My revelations recited to you, but you turned arrogant and were wicked people?"

32.Rashad Khalifa: When it is proclaimed that GOD's promise is the truth and that the Hour (of Judgment) is inevitable, you said, "We do not know what the Hour is! We are full of conjecture about it; we are not certain."

33.Rashad Khalifa: The evils of their works will become evident to them, and the very things they mocked will come back and haunt them.
