34.Rashad Khalifa: It will be proclaimed: "Today we forget you, just as you forgot the meeting of this day. Your abode is the hellfire, and you will have no helpers.

35.Rashad Khalifa: "This is because you took GOD's revelations in vain, and were preoccupied with the first life." Consequently, they will never exit therefrom, nor will they be excused.

36.Rashad Khalifa: To GOD belongs all praise; Lord of the heavens, Lord of the earth, Lord of the universe.

37.Rashad Khalifa: To Him belongs all supremacy in the heavens and the earth. He is the Almighty, Most Wise.

46.SurahEnglishNames: The Wind-curved Sandhills, The Dunes, The Sandhills

1.Rashad Khalifa: H. M.

2.Rashad Khalifa: The revelation of this scripture is from GOD, the Almighty, Most Wise.

3.Rashad Khalifa: We did not create the heavens and the earth, and everything between them except for a specific purpose, and for a finite interim. Those who disbelieve are totally oblivious to the warnings given to them.

4.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "Consider the idols you have set up beside GOD. Show me what on earth did they create. Do they own part of the heavens? Show me any other scripture before this one, or any piece of established knowledge that supports your idolatry, if you are truthful."

5.Rashad Khalifa: Who is farther astray than those who idolize beside GOD idols that can never respond to them until the Day of Resurrection, and are totally unaware of their worship?

6.Rashad Khalifa: And when the people are summoned (on the Day of Judgment), their idols will become their enemies, and will denounce their idolatry.

7.Rashad Khalifa: When our revelations were recited to them, perfectly clear, those whodisbelieved said of the truth that came to them, "This is obviously magic!"

8.Rashad Khalifa: When they say, "He fabricated this," say, "If I fabricated this, then you cannot protect me from GOD. He is fully aware of everything you scheme. He suffices as a witness between me and you. He is the Forgiver, Most Merciful."

9.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "I am not different from other messengers. I have no idea what will happen to me or to you. I only follow what is revealed to me. I am no more than a profound warner."

10.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "What if it is from GOD and you disbelieved in it? A witness from the Children of Israel has borne witness to a similar phenomenon, and he has believed, while you have turned arrogant. Surely, GOD does not guide the wicked people."

11.Rashad Khalifa: Those who disbelieved said about those who believed, "If it were anything good, they would not have accepted it before us." Because they were not guided to it, they said, "This is an old fabrication!"

12.Rashad Khalifa: Before this, the book of Moses provided guidance and mercy. This too is a scripture that confirms, in Arabic, to warn those who transgressed, and to give good news to the righteous.

13.Rashad Khalifa: Surely, those who say, "Our Lord is GOD," then lead a righteous life, will have no fear, nor will they grieve.

14.Rashad Khalifa: They have deserved Paradise, where they abide forever; a reward for their works.

15.Rashad Khalifa: We enjoined the human being to honor his parents. His mother bore him arduously, gave birth to him arduously, and took intimate care of him for thirty months. When he reaches maturity, and reaches the age of forty, he should say, "My Lord, direct me to appreciate the blessings You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents, and to do the righteous works that please You. Let my children be righteous as well. I have repented to You; I am a submitter."

16.Rashad Khalifa: It is from these that we accept the righteous works, and overlook their sins. They have deserved Paradise. This is the truthful promise that is promised to them.

17.Rashad Khalifa: Then there is the one who says to his parents, "Woe to you; are you telling me that (after death) I will come back to life? How come those who died before us never come back?" The parents would cry for GOD's help and say, "Woe to you; please believe! GOD's promise is the truth." He would say, "Tales from the past!"

18.Rashad Khalifa: Such are the ones stamped as disbelievers among every generation of jinns and humans; they are losers.

19.Rashad Khalifa: They all attain the ranks they have deserved, in accordance with their works. He will pay them for their works, without the least injustice.

20.Rashad Khalifa: The day will come when those who disbelieved will be introduced to the hellfire: "You have wasted the good chances given to you during your worldly life, and you rejoiced in them. Consequently, today you incur a shameful retribution as a requital for the arrogance you committed on earth without any basis, and for your evil works."

21.Rashad Khalifa: Recall that the brother of `Aad warned his people at the dunes - numerous warnings were also delivered before him and after him: "You shall not worship except GOD. I fear for you the retribution of a great day."

22.Rashad Khalifa: They said, "Did you come to divert us from our gods? We challenge you to bring (the retribution) you threaten, if you are truthful."

23.Rashad Khalifa: He said, "The knowledge about this is with GOD; I only deliver to you what I was sent to deliver. However, I see that you people are ignorant."

24.Rashad Khalifa: When they saw the storm heading their way, they said, "This storm will bring to us much needed rain." Instead, this is what you challenged (Hood) to bring; violent wind wherein there is painful retribution.

25.Rashad Khalifa: It destroyed everything, as commanded by its Lord. By morning, nothing was standing except their homes. We thus requite the guilty people.

26.Rashad Khalifa: We had established them in the same way as we established you, and provided them with hearing, eyes, and minds. But their hearing, eyes, and minds did not help them at all. This is because they decided to disregard GOD's revelations. Thus, the prophecies and warnings that they ridiculed have caused their doom.

27.Rashad Khalifa: We have annihilated many communities around you, after we had explained the proofs, that they might repent.

28.Rashad Khalifa: Why then did the idols they set up to bring them closer to GOD fail to help them? Instead, they abandoned them. Such were the false gods they idolized; such were the innovations they fabricated.

29.Rashad Khalifa: Recall that we directed a number of jinns to you, in order to let them hear the Quran. When they got there, they said, "Listen." As soon as it was over, they rushed to their people, warning.

30.Rashad Khalifa: They said, "O our people, we have heard a book that was revealed after Moses, and confirms the previous scriptures. It guides to the truth; to the right path.

31.Rashad Khalifa: "O our people, respond to the call of GOD, and believe in Him. He will then forgive your sins, and spare you a painful retribution."

32.Rashad Khalifa: Those who fail to respond to GOD's call cannot escape, and will have no Lord other than Him; they have gone far astray.

33.Rashad Khalifa: Do they not realize that GOD, who created the heavens and the earth without the least effort, is able to revive the dead? Yes indeed; He is Omnipotent.

34.Rashad Khalifa: The day the disbelievers are introduced to the Hellfire, they will be asked, "Is this not the truth?" They will answer, "Yes indeed, by our Lord." He will say, "Then suffer the retribution for your disbelief."

35.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, be patient like the messengers before you who possessed strength and resorted to patience. Do not be in a hurry to see the retribution that will inevitably come to them. The day they see it, it will seem as if they lasted one hour of the day. This is a proclamation: Is it not the wicked who are consistently annihilated?

1.Rashad Khalifa: Those who disbelieve and repel from the path of GOD, He nullifies their works.

2.Rashad Khalifa: Those who believe and work righteousness, and believe in what was sent down to Muhammad - which is the truth from their Lord - He remits their sins, and blesses them with contentment.

3.Rashad Khalifa: This is because those who disbelieve are following falsehood, while those who believe are following the truth from their Lord. GOD thus cites for the people their examples.

4.Rashad Khalifa: If you encounter (in war) those who disbelieve, you may strike the necks. If you take them as captives you may set them free or ransom them, until the war ends. Had GOD willed, He could have granted you victory, without war. But He thus tests you by one another. As for those who get killed in the cause of GOD, He will never put their sacrifice to waste.

5.Rashad Khalifa: He will guide them, and bless them with contentment.

6.Rashad Khalifa: He will admit them into Paradise, that He described to them.

7.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, if you support GOD, He will support you, and strengthen your foothold.

8.Rashad Khalifa: Those who disbelieve incur misery; He causes their works to be utterly in vain.

9.Rashad Khalifa: That is because they hated what GOD revealed and consequently, He nullifies their works.

10.Rashad Khalifa: Did they not roam the earth and see the consequences for those before them? GOD destroyed their works; all disbelievers will suffer the same fate.

11.Rashad Khalifa: This is because GOD is the Lord of those who believe, while the disbelievers have no lord.

12.Rashad Khalifa: GOD admits those who believe and lead a righteous life into gardens with flowing streams. As for those who disbelieve, they live and eat like the animals eat, then end up in the hellfire.

13.Rashad Khalifa: Many a community was much stronger than the community that evicted you from your town; when we annihilated them, no one could help them.

14.Rashad Khalifa: Are those enlightened by their Lord the same as those whose evil works are adorned in their eyes, and they follow their own opinions?

15.Rashad Khalifa: The allegory of Paradise that is promised for the righteous is this: it has rivers of unpolluted water, and rivers of fresh milk, and rivers of wine - delicious for the drinkers - and rivers of strained honey. They have all kinds of fruits therein, and forgiveness from their Lord. (Are they better) or those who abide forever in the hellfire, and drink hellish water that tears up their intestines?

16.Rashad Khalifa: Some of them listen to you, then as soon as they leave they ask those who were enlightened, "What did he just say?" GOD thus seals their hearts and, consequently, they follow only their opinions.

17.Rashad Khalifa: As for those who are guided, He augments their guidance, and grants them their righteousness.

18.Rashad Khalifa: Are they waiting until the Hour comes to them suddenly? All the signs thereof have already come. Once the Hour comes to them, how will they benefit from their message?

19.Rashad Khalifa: You shall know that: "There is no other god beside GOD," and ask forgiveness of your sins and the sins of all believing men and women. GOD is fully aware of your decisions and your ultimate destiny.

20.Rashad Khalifa: Those who believed said: "When will a new sura be revealed?" But when a straightforward sura was revealed, wherein fighting was mentioned, you would see those who harbored doubts in their hearts looking at you, as if death had already come to them. They were thus exposed.

21.Rashad Khalifa: Obedience and righteous utterances are expected of them. If only they showed confidence in GOD, when mobilization was called for, it would have been better for them.

22.Rashad Khalifa: Is it also your intention that as soon as you leave you will commit evil and mistreat your relatives?

23.Rashad Khalifa: It is those who incurred a curse from GOD, whereby He rendered them deaf and blind.

24.Rashad Khalifa: Why do they not study the Quran carefully? Do they have locks on their minds?

25.Rashad Khalifa: Surely, those who slide back, after the guidance has been manifested to them, the devil has enticed them and led them on.

26.Rashad Khalifa: This is because they said to those who hated what GOD has sent down, "We will obey you in certain matters." GOD fully knows their secret conspiracies.

27.Rashad Khalifa: How will it be for them when the angels put them to death? They will beat them on their faces and their rear ends.

28.Rashad Khalifa: This is because they followed what angered GOD and hated the things that please Him. Consequently, He has nullified their works.

29.Rashad Khalifa: Did those who harbor doubts in their hearts think that GOD will not bring out their evil thoughts?

30.Rashad Khalifa: If we will, we can expose them for you, so that you can recognize them just by looking at them. However, you can recognize them by the way they talk. GOD is fully aware of all your works.

31.Rashad Khalifa: We will certainly put you to the test, in order to distinguish those among you who strive, and steadfastly persevere. We must expose your true qualities.

32.Rashad Khalifa: Those who disbelieve and repel from the path of GOD, and oppose the messenger after the guidance has been manifested for them, will never hurt GOD in the least. Instead, He nullifies their works.

33.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, you shall obey GOD, and obey the messenger. Otherwise, all your works will be in vain.

34.Rashad Khalifa: Those who disbelieve and repel from the path of GOD, then die as disbelievers, GOD will never forgive them.

35.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, you shall not waver and surrender in pursuit of peace, for you are guaranteed victory, and GOD is with you. He will never waste your efforts.

36.Rashad Khalifa: This worldly life is no more than play and vanity. But if you believe and lead a righteous life, He will reward you, without asking you for any money.

37.Rashad Khalifa: If He asked you for money, to the extent of creating a hardship for you, you might have become stingy, and your hidden evil might be exposed.

38.Rashad Khalifa: You are invited to spend in the cause of GOD, but some of you turn stingy. The stingy are stingy towards their own souls. GOD is Rich, while you are poor. If you turn away, He will substitute other people in your place, and they will not be like you

1.Rashad Khalifa: We have bestowed upon you (O Messenger) a great victory.

2.Rashad Khalifa: Whereby GOD forgives your past sins, as well as future sins, and perfects His blessings upon you, and guides you in a straight path.

3.Rashad Khalifa: Additionally, GOD will support you with an unwavering support.

4.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who places contentment into the hearts of believers to augment more faith, in addition to their faith. To GOD belongs all forces of the heavens and the earth. GOD is Omniscient, Most Wise.

5.Rashad Khalifa: He will certainly admit the believing men and women into gardens with flowing streams, wherein they abide forever. He will remit their sins. This is, in the sight of GOD, a great triumph.

6.Rashad Khalifa: And He will requite the hypocrite men and women and the idol worshiping men and women, for they have harbored evil thoughts about GOD. Their evil will backfire against them. For GOD is angry with them, condemns them, and has prepared for them Gehenna. What a miserable destiny!

7.Rashad Khalifa: To GOD belongs all the forces in the heavens and the earth. GOD is Almighty, Most Wise.

8.Rashad Khalifa: We have sent you as a witness, a bearer of good news, and a warner.

9.Rashad Khalifa: That you people may believe in GOD and His messenger, and reverence Him, and observe Him, and glorify Him, day and night.

10.Rashad Khalifa: Surely, those who pledge allegiance to you, are pledging allegiance to GOD. GOD approves their pledge; He places His hand above their hands. Those who violate such a pledge, commit the violation to their own detriment. As for those who fulfill their pledge with GOD, He will grant them a great recompense.

11.Rashad Khalifa: The sedentary Arabs who stay behind will say, "We have been preoccupied with our money and our families, so ask forgiveness for us!" They utter with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say, "Who can protect you from GOD, if He willed any adversity for you, or if He willed any blessing for you?" GOD is fully Cognizant of everything you do.

12.Rashad Khalifa: You secretly believed that the messenger and the believers will be defeated and never come back to their families, and this was firmly established in your hearts. You harbored evil thoughts and turned into wicked people.

13.Rashad Khalifa: Anyone who refuses to believe in GOD and His messenger, we have prepared for the disbelievers a hellfire.

14.Rashad Khalifa: To GOD belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whomever He wills, and punishes whomever He wills. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

15.Rashad Khalifa: The sedentary who stay behind will say, when you are expected to collect spoils of war, "Let us follow you to share in this!" They thus wish to alter GOD's words. Say, "You will not follow us. This is GOD's decision." They will then say, "You must be envious of us (for staying behind)." Indeed, they rarely understood anything.

16.Rashad Khalifa: Say to the sedentary Arabs who stay behind, "You will be invited to face powerful people and to fight them, unless they submit. If you obey, GOD will reward you with a generous recompense. But if you turn away again, as you did in the past, He will requite you with a painful retribution."

17.Rashad Khalifa: The blind is not to be blamed, the crippled is not to be blamed, and the sick is not to be blamed. Those who obey GOD and His messenger, He will admit them into gardens with flowing streams. As for those who turn away, He will requite them with a painful retribution.

18.Rashad Khalifa: GOD is pleased with the believers who pledged allegiance to you under the tree. He knew what was in their hearts and, consequently, He blessed them with contentment, and rewarded them with an immediate victory.

19.Rashad Khalifa: Additionally, they gained many spoils. GOD is Almighty, Most Wise.

20.Rashad Khalifa: GOD has promised you many spoils that you will gain. He thus advanced some benefits for you in this life, and He has withheld the people's hands of aggression against you, and has rendered this a sign for the believers. He thus guides you in a straight path.

21.Rashad Khalifa: As for the group that you could not possibly defeat, GOD took care of them; GOD is Omnipotent.

22.Rashad Khalifa: If the disbelievers ever fought you, they would turn around and flee. They have no Lord and Master; they have no helper.

23.Rashad Khalifa: Such is GOD's system throughout history, and you will find that GOD's system is unchangeable.

24.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who withheld their hands of aggression against you, and withheld your hands of aggression against them in the valley of Mecca, after He had granted you victory over them. GOD is Seer of everything you do.

25.Rashad Khalifa: It is they who disbelieved and barred you from the Sacred Masjid, and even prevented your offerings from reaching their destination. There were believing men and women (within the enemy camp) whom you did not know, and you were about to hurt them, unknowingly. GOD thus admits into His mercy whomever He wills. If they persist, He will requite those among them who disbelieve with a painful retribution.

26.Rashad Khalifa: While those who disbelieved were enraged, and their hearts were filled with the pride of the days of ignorance, GOD blessed His messenger and the believers with peaceful contentment, and directed them to uphold the word of righteousness. This is what they well deserved. GOD is fully aware of all things.

27.Rashad Khalifa: GOD has fulfilled His messenger's truthful vision: "You will enter the Sacred Masjid, GOD willing, perfectly secure, and you will cut your hair or shorten it (as you fulfill the pilgrimage rituals) there. You will not have any fear. Since He knew what you did not know, He has coupled this with an immediate victory."

28.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who sent His messenger with the guidance and the religion of truth, to make it prevail over all other religions. GOD suffices as a witness.

29.Rashad Khalifa: Muhammad - the messenger of GOD - and those with him are harsh and stern against the disbelievers, but kind and compassionate amongst themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating, as they seek GOD's blessings and approval. Their marks are on their faces, because of prostrating. This is the same example as in the Torah. Their example in the Gospel is like plants that grow taller and stronger, and please the farmers. He thus enrages the disbelievers. GOD promises those among them who believe, and lead a righteous life, forgiveness and a great recompense.

49.SurahEnglishNames: The Private Apartments, The Inner Apartments, The Chambers

1.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, do not place your opinion above that of GOD and His messenger. You shall reverence GOD. GOD is Hearer, Omniscient.

2.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, do not raise your voices above the voice of the prophet, nor shall you shout at him as you shout at each other, lest your works become nullified while you do not perceive.

3.Rashad Khalifa: Surely, those who lower their voices at the messenger of GOD are the ones whose hearts are prepared by GOD to become righteous. They have deserved forgiveness and a great recompense.

4.Rashad Khalifa: As for those who call on you from outside the walls, most of them do not understand.

5.Rashad Khalifa: Had they been patient until you came out to them, it would have been better for them. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

6.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, if a wicked person brings any news to you, you shall first investigate, lest you commit injustice towards some people, out of ignorance, then become sorry and remorseful for what you have done.

7.Rashad Khalifa: And know that GOD's messenger has come in your midst. Had he listened to you in many things, you would have made things difficult for yourselves. But GOD made you love faith and adorned it in your hearts, and He made you abhor disbelief, wickedness, and disobedience. These are the guided ones.

8.Rashad Khalifa: Such is grace from GOD and His blessings. GOD is Omniscient, Most Wise.

9.Rashad Khalifa: If two groups of believers fought with each other, you shall reconcile them. If one group aggresses against the other, you shall fight the aggressing group until they submit to GOD's command. Once they submit, you shall reconcile the two groups equitably. You shall maintain justice; GOD loves those who are just.

10.Rashad Khalifa: The believers are members of one family; you shall keep the peace within your family and reverence GOD, that you may attain mercy.

11.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, no people shall ridicule other people, for they may be better than they. Nor shall any women ridicule other women, for they may be better than they. Nor shall you mock one another, or make fun of your names. Evil indeed is the reversion to wickedness after attaining faith. Anyone who does not repent after this, these are the transgressors.

12.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, you shall avoid any suspicion, for even a little bit of suspicion is sinful. You shall not spy on one another, nor shall you backbite one another; this is as abominable as eating the flesh of your dead brother. You certainly abhor this. You shall observe GOD. GOD is Redeemer, Most Merciful.

13.Rashad Khalifa: O people, we created you from the same male and female, and rendered you distinct peoples and tribes, that you may recognize one another. The best among you in the sight of GOD is the most righteous. GOD is Omniscient, Cognizant.

14.Rashad Khalifa: The Arabs said, "We are Mu'mens (believers)." Say, "You have not believed; what you should say is, `We are Muslims (submitters),' until belief is established in your hearts." If you obey GOD and His messenger, He will not put any of your works to waste. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

15.Rashad Khalifa: Mu'mens (believers) are those who believe in GOD and His messenger, then attain the status of having no doubt whatsoever, and strive with their money and their lives in the cause of GOD. These are the truthful ones.

16.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "Are you informing GOD about your religion? GOD knows everything in the heavens and the earth. GOD is Omniscient."

17.Rashad Khalifa: They act as if they are doing you a favor by embracing Submission! Say, "You are not doing me any favors by embracing Submission. GOD is the One who is doing you a great favor by guiding you to the faith, if you are sincere."

18.Rashad Khalifa: GOD knows all the secrets in the heavens and the earth; GOD is Seer of everything you do.

1.Rashad Khalifa: Q., and the glorious Quran.

2.Rashad Khalifa: They found it strange that a warner from among them came to them! The disbelievers said, "This is really strange.

3.Rashad Khalifa: "After we die and become dust; this is impossible."

4.Rashad Khalifa: We are fully aware of anyone of them who gets consumed by the earth; we have an accurate record.

5.Rashad Khalifa: They rejected the truth when it came to them; they are utterly confused.

6.Rashad Khalifa: Have they not looked at the sky above them, and how we constructed it and adorned it, without a flaw?

7.Rashad Khalifa: And we created the earth, and scattered on it mountains, and grew in it all kinds of beautiful plants.

8.Rashad Khalifa: This is an enlightenment, and a reminder for every pious worshiper.

9.Rashad Khalifa: And we sent from the sky blessed water, to grow with it gardens and grains to be harvested.

10.Rashad Khalifa: Tall date palms, with clustered fruit.

11.Rashad Khalifa: Provisions for the people. And we revive with it dead lands; you are similarly resurrected.

12.Rashad Khalifa: Disbelieving before them were the people of Noah, the dwellers of Russ, and Thamoud.

13.Rashad Khalifa: And `Aad, Pharaoh, and the brethren of Lot.

14.Rashad Khalifa: And the dwellers of the woods, and the people of Tubba`. All of them disbelieved the messengers and, consequently, My retribution befell them.

15.Rashad Khalifa: Were we too burdened by the first creation? Is this why they doubt resurrection?

16.Rashad Khalifa: We created the human, and we know what he whispers to himself. We are closer to him than his jugular vein.

17.Rashad Khalifa: Two recording (angels), at right and at left, are constantly recording.

18.Rashad Khalifa: Not an utterance does he utter without an alert witness.

19.Rashad Khalifa: Finally, the inevitable coma of death comes; this is what you tried to evade.

20.Rashad Khalifa: The horn is blown; this is the promised day.

21.Rashad Khalifa: Every soul comes with a herder and a witness.

22.Rashad Khalifa: You used to be oblivious to this. We now remove your veil; today, your vision is (as strong as) steel.

23.Rashad Khalifa: The companion said, "Here is my formidable testimony."

24.Rashad Khalifa: Throw into Gehenna every stubborn disbeliever.

25.Rashad Khalifa: Forbidder of charity, aggressor, full of doubt.

26.Rashad Khalifa: He set up beside GOD another god. Throw him into severe retribution.

27.Rashad Khalifa: His companion said, "Our Lord, I did not mislead him; he was far astray."

28.Rashad Khalifa: He said, "Do not feud in front of Me; I have sufficiently warned you.

29.Rashad Khalifa: "Nothing can be changed now. I am never unjust towards the people."

30.Rashad Khalifa: That is the day when we ask Hell, "Have you had enough?" It will say, "Give me more."

31.Rashad Khalifa: Paradise will be offered to the righteous, readily.

32.Rashad Khalifa: This is what was promised to every repenter, steadfast.

33.Rashad Khalifa: They reverenced the Most Gracious, in their privacy, and came wholeheartedly.

34.Rashad Khalifa: Enter it in peace; this is the Day of Eternity.

35.Rashad Khalifa: They get anything they wish therein, and we have even more.

36.Rashad Khalifa: Many a generation before them, who were more powerful, we annihilated. They searched the land; did they find an escape?

37.Rashad Khalifa: This should be a lesson for everyone who possesses a mind, or is able to hear and witness.

38.Rashad Khalifa: We have created the heavens and the earth, and everything between them in six days, and no fatigue touched us.

39.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, be patient in the face of their utterances, and praise and glorify your Lord before sunrise, and before sunset.

40.Rashad Khalifa: During the night you shall meditate on His name, and after prostrating.

41.Rashad Khalifa: Prepare for the day when the caller calls from a place that is near.

42.Rashad Khalifa: When they hear the inevitable cry; that is the day you come out.

43.Rashad Khalifa: We are the ones who control life and death; to us is the final destiny.

44.Rashad Khalifa: The day will come when the earth cracks in a hurry, giving rise to them. Such summoning is easy for us to do.

45.Rashad Khalifa: We are fully aware of everything they utter, while you have no power over them. Therefore, remind with this Quran, those who reverence My warnings.

1.Rashad Khalifa: The blowing winds.

2.Rashad Khalifa: Bearing rain.

3.Rashad Khalifa: Bringing provisions.

4.Rashad Khalifa: Distributing them as commanded.

5.Rashad Khalifa: What is promised to you will surely come to pass.

6.Rashad Khalifa: The Day of Judgment is inevitable.

7.Rashad Khalifa: Despite the perfectly created sky.

8.Rashad Khalifa: You continue to dispute the truth.

9.Rashad Khalifa: Deviating therefrom are the deviators.

10.Rashad Khalifa: Woe to the falsifiers.

11.Rashad Khalifa: In their blundering, they are totally heedless.

12.Rashad Khalifa: They question the Day of Judgment.

13.Rashad Khalifa: The day they are presented to the fire.

14.Rashad Khalifa: Taste the retribution; this is what you used to challenge.

15.Rashad Khalifa: The righteous have deserved gardens and springs.

16.Rashad Khalifa: They receive their Lord's rewards, for they used to be pious.

17.Rashad Khalifa: Rarely did they sleep the whole night.

18.Rashad Khalifa: At dawn, they prayed for forgiveness.

19.Rashad Khalifa: A portion of their money was set aside for the beggar and the needy.

20.Rashad Khalifa: The earth is full of signs for those who are certain.

21.Rashad Khalifa: And within yourselves; can you see?

22.Rashad Khalifa: In the heaven is your provision, and everything that is promised to you.

23.Rashad Khalifa: By the Lord of the heaven and the earth, this is as true as the fact that you speak.

24.Rashad Khalifa: Have you noted the history of Abraham's honorable guests?

25.Rashad Khalifa: They visited him, saying, "Peace." He said, "Peace to you, strangers!"

26.Rashad Khalifa: He asked his family to prepare a fat calf.

27.Rashad Khalifa: When he offered it to them, he remarked, "Do you not eat?"

28.Rashad Khalifa: He harbored fear of them. They said, "Have no fear," and they gave good news of a knowledgeable son.

29.Rashad Khalifa: His wife was astonished. Noting her wrinkled face: "I am a sterile old woman."

30.Rashad Khalifa: They said, "Thus said your Lord. He is the Most Wise, the Omniscient."

31.Rashad Khalifa: He said, "What are you up to, O messengers?"

32.Rashad Khalifa: They said, "We have been dispatched to criminal people.

33.Rashad Khalifa: "We will shower them with rocks of clay.

34.Rashad Khalifa: "Marked by your Lord for the transgressors."

35.Rashad Khalifa: We then delivered all the believers.

36.Rashad Khalifa: We did not find in it except one house of submitters.

37.Rashad Khalifa: We set it up as a lesson for those who fear the painful retribution.

38.Rashad Khalifa: In Moses (there is a lesson). We sent him to Pharaoh with manifest proofs.

39.Rashad Khalifa: But he turned away, in arrogance, and said, "Magician, or crazy."

40.Rashad Khalifa: Consequently, we punished him and his troops. We threw them into the sea, and he is the one to blame.

41.Rashad Khalifa: In `Aad (there is a lesson). We sent upon them disastrous wind.

42.Rashad Khalifa: Anything that it came upon was utterly destroyed.

43.Rashad Khalifa: In Thamoud (there is a lesson). They were told, "Enjoy temporarily."

44.Rashad Khalifa: They rebelled against the command of their Lord. Consequently, the lightning struck them as they looked.

45.Rashad Khalifa: They could never get up, nor were they helped.

46.Rashad Khalifa: And the people of Noah before that; they were wicked people.

47.Rashad Khalifa: We constructed the sky with our hands, and we will continue to expand it.

48.Rashad Khalifa: And we made the earth habitable; a perfect design.

49.Rashad Khalifa: We created a pair (male and female) of everything, that you may take heed.

50.Rashad Khalifa: You shall escape to GOD. I am sent by Him to you as a manifest warner.

51.Rashad Khalifa: KHALIFA:Do not set up beside GOD any other god. I am sent by Him to you as a manifest warner.

52.Rashad Khalifa: Consistently, when a messenger went to the previous generations, they said, "Magician," or, "Crazy."

53.Rashad Khalifa: Did they make an agreement with each other? Indeed, they are transgressors.

54.Rashad Khalifa: You may disregard them; you cannot be blamed.

55.Rashad Khalifa: And remind, for the reminder benefits the believers.

56.Rashad Khalifa: I did not create the jinns and the humans except to worship Me alone.

57.Rashad Khalifa: I need no provisions from them, nor do I need them to feed Me.

58.Rashad Khalifa: GOD is the Provider, the Possessor of all power, the Supreme.

59.Rashad Khalifa: The transgressors have incurred the same fate as their previous counterparts; they should not challenge.

60.Rashad Khalifa: Woe to those who disbelieved from the day that is awaiting them.

1.Rashad Khalifa: Mt. Sinai.

2.Rashad Khalifa: The recorded scripture.

3.Rashad Khalifa: Published in books.

4.Rashad Khalifa: The frequented Shrine.

5.Rashad Khalifa: The exalted ceiling.

6.Rashad Khalifa: The sea that is set aflame.

7.Rashad Khalifa: Your Lord's requital is unavoidable.

8.Rashad Khalifa: No force in the universe can stop it.

9.Rashad Khalifa: The day will come when the sky will violently thunder.

10.Rashad Khalifa: The mountains will be wiped out.

11.Rashad Khalifa: Woe on that day to the disbelievers -

12.Rashad Khalifa: who are in their blundering, heedless.

13.Rashad Khalifa: They will be herded into Gehenna, forcibly.

14.Rashad Khalifa: This is the Fire in which you used to disbelieve.

15.Rashad Khalifa: Is this magic, or do you not see?

16.Rashad Khalifa: Suffer the burning. Whether you are patient or impatient, it will be the same for you. This is the just requital for what you did.

17.Rashad Khalifa: The righteous have deserved gardens and bliss.

18.Rashad Khalifa: They enjoy what their Lord has reserved for them; their Lord has spared them the retribution of Hell.

19.Rashad Khalifa: Eat and drink happily, in return for your works.

20.Rashad Khalifa: They relax on luxurious furnishings, and we match them with beautiful spouses.

21.Rashad Khalifa: For those who believed, and their children also followed them in belief, we will have their children join them. We never fail to reward them for any work. Every person is paid for what he did.

22.Rashad Khalifa: We will supply them with fruits and meats that they love.

23.Rashad Khalifa: They will enjoy drinks that are never polluted, and never sinful to drink.

24.Rashad Khalifa: Serving them will be servants like protected pearls.

25.Rashad Khalifa: They will meet each other and reminisce among themselves.

26.Rashad Khalifa: They will say, "We used to be kind and humble among our people.

27.Rashad Khalifa: "GOD has blessed us, and has spared us the agony of ill winds.

28.Rashad Khalifa: "We used to implore Him; He is the Most Kind, Most Merciful."

29.Rashad Khalifa: You shall remind the people. With your Lord's blessing's upon you, you are neither a soothsayer, nor crazy.

30.Rashad Khalifa: They may say, "He is a poet; let us just wait until he is dead."

31.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "Go on waiting; I will wait along with you."

32.Rashad Khalifa: Is it their dreams that dictate their behavior, or are they naturally wicked?

33.Rashad Khalifa: Do they say, "He made it all up?" Instead, they are simply disbelievers.

34.Rashad Khalifa: Let them produce a Hadith like this, if they are truthful.

35.Rashad Khalifa: Were they created from nothing? Are they the creators?

36.Rashad Khalifa: Did they create the heavens and the earth? Indeed, they have no certainty.

37.Rashad Khalifa: Do they possess the treasures of your Lord? Are they in control?

38.Rashad Khalifa: Do they climb a ladder that enables them to listen? Let their listeners show their proof.

39.Rashad Khalifa: Does He have daughters, while you have sons?

40.Rashad Khalifa: Are you asking them for any wage, and they are burdened thereby?

41.Rashad Khalifa: Do they know the future, and have it recorded?

42.Rashad Khalifa: Are they plotting and scheming? The disbelievers' schemes backfire against them.

43.Rashad Khalifa: Do they have another god beside GOD? GOD be glorified, far above having partners.

44.Rashad Khalifa: When they see masses falling from the sky, they will say, "Piled clouds!"

45.Rashad Khalifa: Disregard them until they meet the day in which they are struck.

46.Rashad Khalifa: On that day, their schemes will not protect them, nor will they be helped.

47.Rashad Khalifa: Those who transgress suffer retribution here, but most of them do not know.

48.Rashad Khalifa: You shall steadfastly persevere in carrying out your Lord's command - you are in our eyes - and glorify and praise your Lord when you get up.

49.Rashad Khalifa: Also during the night glorify Him, and at dawn as the stars fade away.

1.Rashad Khalifa: As the stars fell away.

2.Rashad Khalifa: Your friend (Muhammad) was not astray, nor was he deceived.

3.Rashad Khalifa: Nor was he speaking out of a personal desire.

4.Rashad Khalifa: It was divine inspiration.

5.Rashad Khalifa: Dictated by the Most Powerful.

6.Rashad Khalifa: Possessor of all authority. From His highest height.

7.Rashad Khalifa: At the highest horizon.

8.Rashad Khalifa: He drew nearer by moving down.

9.Rashad Khalifa: Until He became as close as possible.

10.Rashad Khalifa: He then revealed to His servant what was to be revealed.

11.Rashad Khalifa: The mind never made up what it saw.

12.Rashad Khalifa: Are you doubting what he saw?

13.Rashad Khalifa: He saw him in another descent.

14.Rashad Khalifa: At the ultimate point.

15.Rashad Khalifa: Where the eternal Paradise is located.

16.Rashad Khalifa: The whole place was overwhelmed.

17.Rashad Khalifa: The eyes did not waver, nor go blind.

18.Rashad Khalifa: He saw great signs of his Lord.

19.Rashad Khalifa: Compare this with the female idols Allaat and Al-`Uzzah.

20.Rashad Khalifa: And Manaat, the third one.

21.Rashad Khalifa: Do you have sons, while He has these as daughters?

22.Rashad Khalifa: What a disgraceful distribution!

23.Rashad Khalifa: These are but names that you made up, you and your forefathers. GOD never authorized such a blasphemy. They follow conjecture, and personal desire, when the true guidance has come to them herein from their Lord.

24.Rashad Khalifa: What is it that the human being desires?

25.Rashad Khalifa: To GOD belongs both the Hereafter, and this world.

26.Rashad Khalifa: Not even the angels in heaven possess authority to intercede. The only ones permitted by GOD are those who act in accordance with His will and His approval.

27.Rashad Khalifa: Those who disbelieve in the Hereafter have given the angels feminine names.

28.Rashad Khalifa: They had no knowledge about this; they only conjectured. Conjecture is no substitute for the truth.

29.Rashad Khalifa: You shall disregard those who turn away from our message, and become preoccupied with this worldly life.

30.Rashad Khalifa: This is the extent of their knowledge. Your Lord is fully aware of those who strayed away from His path, and He is fully aware of those who are guided.

31.Rashad Khalifa: To GOD belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth. He will requite those who commit evil for their works, and will reward the righteous for their righteousness.

32.Rashad Khalifa: They avoid gross sins and transgressions, except for minor offenses. Your Lord's forgiveness is immense. He has been fully aware of you since He initiated you from the earth, and while you were embryos in your mothers' bellies. Therefore, do not exalt yourselves; He is fully aware of the righteous.

33.Rashad Khalifa: Have you noted the one who turned away?

34.Rashad Khalifa: Rarely did he give to charity, and then very little.

35.Rashad Khalifa: Did he possess knowledge of the future? Could he see it?

36.Rashad Khalifa: Was he not informed of the teachings in the scripture of Moses?

37.Rashad Khalifa: And Abraham who fulfilled?

38.Rashad Khalifa: No soul bears the sins of another soul.

39.Rashad Khalifa: Every human being is responsible for his own works.

40.Rashad Khalifa: And everyone's works will be shown.

41.Rashad Khalifa: Then they will be paid fully for such works.

42.Rashad Khalifa: To your Lord is the final destiny.

43.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who makes you laugh or cry.

44.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who controls death and life.

45.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who created the two kinds, male and female -

46.Rashad Khalifa: from a tiny drop of semen.

47.Rashad Khalifa: He will effect the recreation.

48.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who makes you rich or poor.

49.Rashad Khalifa: He is the Lord of the galaxies.

50.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who annihilated ancient `Aad.

51.Rashad Khalifa: And wiped out Thamoud.

52.Rashad Khalifa: Also the people of Noah before that; they were evil transgressors.

53.Rashad Khalifa: The evil communities (of Sodom and Gomorrah) were the lowliest.

54.Rashad Khalifa: Consequently, they utterly vanished.

55.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

56.Rashad Khalifa: This is a warning like the older ones.

57.Rashad Khalifa: The inevitable is imminent.

58.Rashad Khalifa: None beside GOD can relieve it.

59.Rashad Khalifa: Are you questioning this matter?

60.Rashad Khalifa: Are you laughing, instead of crying?

61.Rashad Khalifa: Are you insisting on your ways?

62.Rashad Khalifa: You shall fall prostrate before GOD, and worship.

1.Rashad Khalifa: The Hour has come closer, and the moon has split.

2.Rashad Khalifa: Then they saw a miracle; but they turned away and said, "Old magic."

3.Rashad Khalifa: They disbelieved, followed their opinions, and adhered to their old traditions.

4.Rashad Khalifa: Sufficient warnings have been delivered to alert them.

5.Rashad Khalifa: Great wisdom; but all the warnings have been in vain.

6.Rashad Khalifa: Ignore them; the day will come when the caller will announce a terrible disaster.

7.Rashad Khalifa: With their eyes humiliated, they come out of the graves like scattered locusts.

8.Rashad Khalifa: As they respond to the caller, the disbelievers will say, "This is a difficult day."

9.Rashad Khalifa: The people of Noah disbelieved before them. They disbelieved our servant and said, "Crazy!" He was persecuted.

10.Rashad Khalifa: He implored his Lord, "I am oppressed; grant me victory."

11.Rashad Khalifa: We then opened the gates of the sky, pouring water.

12.Rashad Khalifa: And we caused springs to gush out of the earth. The waters met to effect a predetermined decision.

13.Rashad Khalifa: We carried him on a watercraft made of logs and ropes.

14.Rashad Khalifa: It ran under our watchful eyes; a reward for one who was rejected.

15.Rashad Khalifa: We have set it up as a lesson. Does any of you wish to learn?

16.Rashad Khalifa: How terrible was My retribution after the warnings!

17.Rashad Khalifa: We made the Quran easy to learn. Does any of you wish to learn?

18.Rashad Khalifa: `Aad disbelieved. Consequently, how terrible was My retribution after the warnings.

19.Rashad Khalifa: We sent upon them violent winds, on a day of continuous misery.

20.Rashad Khalifa: It tossed the people around as if they were decayed palm tree trunks.

21.Rashad Khalifa: How terrible was My retribution after the warnings!

22.Rashad Khalifa: We made the Quran easy to learn. Does any of you wish to learn?

23.Rashad Khalifa: Thamoud rejected the warnings.

24.Rashad Khalifa: They said, "Shall we follow one of us; a human being? We will then go astray, then end up in Hell.

25.Rashad Khalifa: "Did the message come down to him, instead of us? He is a flagrant liar."

26.Rashad Khalifa: They will find out tomorrow who the flagrant liar is.

27.Rashad Khalifa: We are sending the camel as a test for them. Watch them and be patient.

28.Rashad Khalifa: Inform them that the water shall be divided among them; (the camel) shall be allowed to drink on her designated day.

29.Rashad Khalifa: But they persuaded their friend to kill (the camel), and he obliged.

30.Rashad Khalifa: Consequently, how terrible was My retribution! They have been warned.

31.Rashad Khalifa: We sent upon them one blow, whereupon they became like harvested hay.

32.Rashad Khalifa: We made the Quran easy to learn. Does any of you wish to learn?

33.Rashad Khalifa: The people of Lot rejected the warnings.

34.Rashad Khalifa: We showered them with rocks. Only Lot's family was saved at dawn.

35.Rashad Khalifa: We blessed him and his family; we thus reward the appreciative.

36.Rashad Khalifa: He warned them about our requital, but they ridiculed the warnings.

37.Rashad Khalifa: They negotiated with him about his guests; we blinded them. Suffer My retribution; you have been warned.

38.Rashad Khalifa: Early the next morning, a devastating retribution struck them.

39.Rashad Khalifa: Suffer My retribution; you have been warned.

40.Rashad Khalifa: We made the Quran easy to learn. Does any of you wish to learn?

41.Rashad Khalifa: Pharaoh's people were warned.

42.Rashad Khalifa: They rejected all our signs. Consequently, we requited them as an Almighty, Omnipotent should.

43.Rashad Khalifa: Are your disbelievers better than those disbelievers? Have you been absolved by the scripture?

44.Rashad Khalifa: Perhaps they think, "We will be the winners."

45.Rashad Khalifa: All of them will be defeated; they will turn around and flee.

46.Rashad Khalifa: The Hour is awaiting them, and the Hour is far worse and more painful.

47.Rashad Khalifa: Certainly, the guilty are astray, and will end up in Hell.

48.Rashad Khalifa: They will be dragged into the hellfire, forcibly. Suffer the agony of retribution.

49.Rashad Khalifa: Everything we created is precisely measured.

50.Rashad Khalifa: Our commands are done within the blink of an eye.

51.Rashad Khalifa: We annihilated your counterparts. Does any of you wish to learn?

52.Rashad Khalifa: Everything they did is recorded in the scriptures.

53.Rashad Khalifa: Everything, small or large, is written down.

54.Rashad Khalifa: Surely, the righteous have deserved gardens and rivers.

55.Rashad Khalifa: In a position of honor, at an Omnipotent King.

55.SurahEnglishNames: The Beneficent, The Mercy Giving, The Merciful

1.Rashad Khalifa: The Most Gracious.

2.Rashad Khalifa: Teacher of the Quran.

3.Rashad Khalifa: Creator of the human beings.

4.Rashad Khalifa: He taught them how to distinguish.

5.Rashad Khalifa: The sun and the moon are perfectly calculated.

6.Rashad Khalifa: The stars and the trees prostrate.

7.Rashad Khalifa: He constructed the sky and established the law.

8.Rashad Khalifa: You shall not transgress the law.

9.Rashad Khalifa: You shall establish justice; do not violate the law.

10.Rashad Khalifa: He created the earth for all creatures.

11.Rashad Khalifa: In it there are fruits, and date palms with their hanging fruit.

12.Rashad Khalifa: Also grains and the spices.

13.Rashad Khalifa: (O humans and jinns,) which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

14.Rashad Khalifa: He created the human from aged clay, like the potter's clay.

15.Rashad Khalifa: And created the jinns from blazing fire.

16.Rashad Khalifa: (O humans and jinns,) which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

17.Rashad Khalifa: Lord of the two easts and the two wests.

18.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

19.Rashad Khalifa: He separates the two seas where they meet.

20.Rashad Khalifa: A barrier is placed between them, to prevent them from transgressing.

21.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

22.Rashad Khalifa: Out of both of them you get pearls and coral.

23.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

24.Rashad Khalifa: He gave you ships that roam the sea like flags.

25.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

26.Rashad Khalifa: Everyone on earth perishes.

27.Rashad Khalifa: Only the presence of your Lord lasts. Possessor of Majesty and Honor.

28.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

29.Rashad Khalifa: Imploring Him is everyone in the heavens and the earth. Every day He is in full control.

30.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

31.Rashad Khalifa: We will call you to account, O humans and jinns.

32.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

33.Rashad Khalifa: O you jinns and humans, if you can penetrate the outer limits of the heavens and the earth, go ahead and penetrate. You cannot penetrate without authorization.

34.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

35.Rashad Khalifa: You get bombarded with projectiles of fire and metal, and you cannot win.

36.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

37.Rashad Khalifa: When the sky disintegrates, and turns rose colored like paint.

38.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

39.Rashad Khalifa: On that day, no human, nor a jinn, will be asked about his sins.

40.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

41.Rashad Khalifa: (This is because) the guilty will be recognized by their looks; they will be taken by the forelocks and the feet.

42.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

43.Rashad Khalifa: This is Gehenna that the guilty used to deny.

44.Rashad Khalifa: They will circulate between it and an intolerable inferno.

45.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

46.Rashad Khalifa: For those who reverence the majesty of their Lord, two gardens (one for the jinns and one for the humans).

47.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

48.Rashad Khalifa: Full of provisions.

49.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

50.Rashad Khalifa: Two springs are in them, flowing.

51.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

52.Rashad Khalifa: Of every fruit in them, two kinds.

53.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

54.Rashad Khalifa: While relaxing on furnishings lined with satin, the fruits are within reach.

55.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

56.Rashad Khalifa: Their beautiful mates were never touched by any human or jinn.

57.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

58.Rashad Khalifa: They look like gems and coral.

59.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

61.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

63.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

65.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

66.Rashad Khalifa: In them, wells to be pumped.

67.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

68.Rashad Khalifa: In them are fruits, date palms, and pomegranate.

69.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

70.Rashad Khalifa: In them are beautiful mates.

71.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

73.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?

75.Rashad Khalifa: Which of your Lord's marvels can you deny?
