56.SurahEnglishNames: The Event, The Inevitable, That Which is Coming

1.Rashad Khalifa: When the inevitable comes to pass.

2.Rashad Khalifa: Nothing can stop it from happening.

3.Rashad Khalifa: It will lower some, and raise others.

4.Rashad Khalifa: The earth will be shaken up.

5.Rashad Khalifa: The mountains will be wiped out.

6.Rashad Khalifa: As if they never existed.

7.Rashad Khalifa: You will be stratified into three kinds.

8.Rashad Khalifa: Those who deserved bliss will be in bliss.

9.Rashad Khalifa: Those who deserved misery will be in misery.

10.Rashad Khalifa: Then there is the elite of the elite.

11.Rashad Khalifa: They are those who will be closest (to God).

12.Rashad Khalifa: In the gardens of bliss.

13.Rashad Khalifa: Many from the first generations.

14.Rashad Khalifa: Few from the later generations.

15.Rashad Khalifa: On luxurious furnishings.

16.Rashad Khalifa: Enjoying everything, they will be neighbors.

17.Rashad Khalifa: Serving them will be immortal servants.

18.Rashad Khalifa: With cups, pitchers and pure drinks.

19.Rashad Khalifa: They never run out, nor do they get bored.

20.Rashad Khalifa: Fruits of their choice.

21.Rashad Khalifa: Meat of birds that they desire.

22.Rashad Khalifa: Beautiful mates.

23.Rashad Khalifa: Like protected pearls.

24.Rashad Khalifa: Rewards for their works.

25.Rashad Khalifa: They never hear any nonsense therein, nor sinful utterances.

26.Rashad Khalifa: Only the utterance: "Peace, peace."

27.Rashad Khalifa: Those of the right side, will be on the right side.

28.Rashad Khalifa: In lush orchards

29.Rashad Khalifa: Fragrant fruits.

30.Rashad Khalifa: Extended shade.

31.Rashad Khalifa: Abundant water.

32.Rashad Khalifa: Many fruits.

33.Rashad Khalifa: Never ending; never forbidden.

34.Rashad Khalifa: Luxurious furnishings.

35.Rashad Khalifa: We create for them mates.

36.Rashad Khalifa: Never previously touched.

37.Rashad Khalifa: Perfectly matched.

38.Rashad Khalifa: For those on the right side.

39.Rashad Khalifa: Many from the early generations.

40.Rashad Khalifa: Many from the later generations.

41.Rashad Khalifa: Those of the left, will be on the left.

42.Rashad Khalifa: In misery and inferno.

43.Rashad Khalifa: Even their shade is hot.

44.Rashad Khalifa: Never cool, never tolerable.

45.Rashad Khalifa: They used to be rich.

46.Rashad Khalifa: They insisted on the great blasphemy.

47.Rashad Khalifa: They said, "After we die and turn to dust and bones, we get resurrected?

48.Rashad Khalifa: "Does this include our forefathers?"

49.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "The early generations and the later generations.

50.Rashad Khalifa: "Will be summoned to a meeting on a predetermined day.

51.Rashad Khalifa: "Then you, O disbelieving strayers.

52.Rashad Khalifa: "Will eat from the trees of bitterness.

53.Rashad Khalifa: "Filling your bellies therefrom.

54.Rashad Khalifa: "Then drinking on top of it hellish drinks.

55.Rashad Khalifa: "Then adding drinks of sand."

56.Rashad Khalifa: Such is their share on the Day of Judgment.

57.Rashad Khalifa: We have created you, if you could only believe!

58.Rashad Khalifa: Have you noted the semen that you produce?

59.Rashad Khalifa: Did you create it, or did we?

60.Rashad Khalifa: We have predetermined death for you. Nothing can stop us -

61.Rashad Khalifa: from substituting new generations in your place, and establishing what you do not know.

62.Rashad Khalifa: You know about the first creation. Do you not remember?

63.Rashad Khalifa: Have you noted the crops you reap?

64.Rashad Khalifa: Did you grow them, or did we?

65.Rashad Khalifa: If we will, we can turn it into hay. Then you will lament:

66.Rashad Khalifa: "We lost.

67.Rashad Khalifa: "We are deprived."

68.Rashad Khalifa: Have you noted the water you drink?

69.Rashad Khalifa: Did you send it down from the clouds, or did we?

70.Rashad Khalifa: If we will, we can make it salty. You should be thankful.

71.Rashad Khalifa: Have you noted the fire you ignite?

72.Rashad Khalifa: Did you initiate its tree, or did we?

73.Rashad Khalifa: We rendered it a reminder, and a useful tool for the users.

74.Rashad Khalifa: You shall glorify the name of your Lord, the Great.

75.Rashad Khalifa: I swear by the positions of the stars.

76.Rashad Khalifa: This is an oath, if you only knew, that is awesome.

77.Rashad Khalifa: This is an honorable Quran.

78.Rashad Khalifa: In a protected book.

79.Rashad Khalifa: None can grasp it except the sincere.

80.Rashad Khalifa: A revelation from the Lord of the universe.

81.Rashad Khalifa: Are you disregarding this narration?

82.Rashad Khalifa: Do you make it your business that you disbelieve?

83.Rashad Khalifa: When the time comes and it (your soul) reaches your throat -

84.Rashad Khalifa: you will then look around.

85.Rashad Khalifa: We are closer to it than you are, but you do not see.

86.Rashad Khalifa: If it is true that you do not owe any accounting -

87.Rashad Khalifa: why do you not restore (your soul), if you are truthful?

88.Rashad Khalifa: If he is one of those close to Me -

89.Rashad Khalifa: then joy, flowers, and gardens of bliss.

90.Rashad Khalifa: And if he is one of the right -

91.Rashad Khalifa: peace is the lot of those on the right.

92.Rashad Khalifa: But if he is one of the disbelievers, the strayers -

93.Rashad Khalifa: then an abode of inferno -

94.Rashad Khalifa: and burning in Hell.

95.Rashad Khalifa: This is the absolute truth.

96.Rashad Khalifa: You shall glorify the name of your Lord, the Great.

1.Rashad Khalifa: Glorifying GOD is everything in the heavens and the earth. He is the Almighty, Most Wise.

2.Rashad Khalifa: To Him belongs the kingship of the heavens and the earth. He controls life and death. He is Omnipotent.

3.Rashad Khalifa: He is the Alpha and the Omega. He is the Outermost and the Innermost. He is fully aware of all things.

4.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who created the heavens and the earth in six days, then assumed all authority. He knows everything that enters into the earth, and everything that comes out of it, and everything that comes down from the sky, and everything that climbs into it. He is with you wherever you may be. GOD is Seer of everything you do.

5.Rashad Khalifa: To Him belongs the kingship of the heavens and the earth. All matters are controlled by GOD.

6.Rashad Khalifa: He merges the night into the day, and merges the day into the night. He is fully aware of the innermost thoughts.

7.Rashad Khalifa: Believe in GOD and His messenger, and give from what He has bestowed upon you. Those among you who believe and give (to charity) have deserved a great recompense.

8.Rashad Khalifa: Why should you not believe in GOD when the messenger is inviting you to believe in your Lord? He has taken a pledge from you, if you are believers.

9.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who sends down to His servant clear revelations, in order to lead you out of the darkness into the light. GOD is Compassionate towards you, Most Merciful.

10.Rashad Khalifa: Why do you not spend in the cause of GOD, when GOD possesses all wealth in the heavens and the earth? Distinguished from the rest are those among you who spend before the victory and strive. They attain a greater rank than those who spend after the victory and strive. For each, GOD promises salvation. GOD is Cognizant of everything you do.

11.Rashad Khalifa: Who would like to loan GOD a loan of righteousness, to have it multiplied for him manifold, and end up with a generous recompense?

12.Rashad Khalifa: The day will come when you see the believing men and women with their lights radiating ahead of them and to their right. Good news is yours that, on that day, you will have gardens with flowing streams. You will abide therein forever. This is the great triumph.

13.Rashad Khalifa: On that day, the hypocrite men and women will say to those who believed, "Please allow us to absorb some of your light." It will be said, "Go back behind you, and seek light." A barrier will be set up between them, whose gate separates mercy on the inner side, from retribution on the outer side.

14.Rashad Khalifa: They will call upon them, "Were we not with you?" They will answer, "Yes, but you cheated your souls, hesitated, doubted, and became misled by wishful thinking, until GOD's judgment came. You were diverted from GOD by illusions.

15.Rashad Khalifa: "Therefore, today no ransom can be taken from you, nor from those who disbelieved. Your abode is the fire; it is your lord, and miserable abode."

16.Rashad Khalifa: Is it not time for those who believed to open up their hearts for GOD's message, and the truth that is revealed herein? They should not be like the followers of previous scriptures whose hearts became hardened with time and, consequently, many of them turned wicked.

17.Rashad Khalifa: Know that GOD revives the land after it had died. We thus explain the revelations for you, that you may understand.

18.Rashad Khalifa: Surely, the charitable men and women, have loaned GOD a loan of goodness. They will receive their reward multiplied manifold; they have deserved a generous recompense.

19.Rashad Khalifa: Those who believed in GOD and His messengers are the saints and martyrs. Reserved for them at their Lord are their rewards and their light. As for those who disbelieved and rejected our revelations, they have incurred Hell.

20.Rashad Khalifa: Know that this worldly life is no more than play and games, and boasting among you, and hoarding of money and children. It is like abundant rain that produces plants and pleases the disbelievers. But then the plants turn into useless hay, and are blown away by the wind. In the Hereafter there is either severe retribution, or forgiveness from GOD and approval. This worldly life is no more than a temporary illusion.

21.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, you shall race towards forgiveness from your Lord, and a Paradise whose width encompasses the heaven and the earth. It awaits those who believed in GOD and His messengers. Such is GOD's grace that He bestows upon whomever He wills. GOD is Possessor of Infinite Grace.

22.Rashad Khalifa: Anything that happens on earth, or to you, has already been recorded, even before the creation. This is easy for GOD to do.

23.Rashad Khalifa: Thus, you should not grieve over anything you miss, nor be proud of anything He has bestowed upon you. GOD does not love those who are boastful, proud.

24.Rashad Khalifa: They are stingy, and enjoin the people to be stingy. If one turns away, then GOD is the Rich, the Praiseworthy.

25.Rashad Khalifa: We sent our messengers supported by clear proofs, and we sent down to them the scripture and the law, that the people may uphold justice. And we sent down the iron, wherein there is strength, and many benefits for the people. All this in order for GOD to distinguish those who would support Him and His messengers, on faith. GOD is Powerful, Almighty.

26.Rashad Khalifa: We sent Noah and Abraham, and we granted their descendants prophethood and the scripture. Some of them were guided, while many were wicked.

27.Rashad Khalifa: Subsequent to them, we sent our messengers. We sent Jesus the son of Mary, and we gave him the Injeel (Gospel), and we placed in the hearts of his followers kindness and mercy. But they invented hermitism which we never decreed for them. All we asked them to do was to uphold the commandments approved by GOD. But they did not uphold the message as they should have. Consequently, we gave those who believed among them their recompense, while many of them were wicked.

28.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, you shall reverence GOD and believe in His messenger. He will then grant you double the reward from His mercy, endow you with light to guide you, and forgive you. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

29.Rashad Khalifa: Thus, the followers of previous scripture should know that they have not monopolized GOD's mercy and grace, and that all grace is in GOD's hand. He bestows it upon whomever He wills. GOD is Possessor of Infinite Grace.

58.SurahEnglishNames: She That Disputeth, The Pleading Woman, She Who Pleaded

1.Rashad Khalifa: GOD has heard the woman who debated with you about her husband, and complained to GOD. GOD heard everything the two of you discussed. GOD is Hearer, Seer.

2.Rashad Khalifa: Those among you who estrange their wives (by declaring them as forbidden in sex) as their mothers know full well that they are not their mothers. Their mothers are the women who gave birth to them. Indeed, they are committing a blasphemy and a falsehood. GOD is Pardoner, Forgiver.

3.Rashad Khalifa: Those who estrange their wives in this manner, then reconcile thereafter, shall atone by freeing a slave before resuming their sexual relations. This is to enlighten you. GOD is Cognizant of everything you do.

4.Rashad Khalifa: If you cannot find a slave to free, you shall fast two consecutive months before resuming sexual relations. If you cannot fast, then you shall feed sixty poor people. You shall believe in GOD and His messenger. These are GOD's laws. The disbelievers have incurred a painful retribution.

5.Rashad Khalifa: Surely, those who fight GOD and His messenger are committed to defeat, like their previous counterparts were committed to defeat. We have sent down clear proofs, and the rejectors have incurred a shameful retribution.

6.Rashad Khalifa: The day will come when GOD will resurrect them all, then inform them of everything they had done. GOD has recorded everything, while they have forgotten it. GOD witnesses all things.

7.Rashad Khalifa: Do you not realize that GOD knows everything in the heavens and everything on earth? No three people can conspire secretly without Him being their fourth, nor five without Him being the sixth, nor less than that, nor more, without Him being there with them wherever they may be. Then, on the Day of Resurrection, He will inform them of everything they had done. GOD is fully aware of all things.

8.Rashad Khalifa: Have you noted those who were enjoined from conspiring secretly, then insist on conspiring? They conspire to commit sin, transgression, and disobedience of the messenger. When they come to you, they greet you with a greeting other than that decreed by GOD. They say inside themselves, "GOD will not punish us for our utterances." Their only requital is Gehenna, wherein they burn; what a miserable destiny.

9.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, if you have to confer secretly, you shall not confer to commit sin, transgression, and to disobey the messenger. You shall confer to work righteousness and piety. You shall reverence GOD, before whom you will be summoned.

10.Rashad Khalifa: Secret conspiracy is the devil's idea, through which he seeks to hurt those who believed. However, he cannot hurt them against GOD's will. In GOD the believers shall trust.

11.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, if you are told, "Please make room," you shall make room for each other to sit. GOD will then make room for you. If you are asked to get up and move, get up and move. GOD raises those among you who believe, and those who acquire knowledge to higher ranks. GOD is fully Cognizant of everything you do.

12.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, when you wish to confer with the messenger, you shall offer a charity (to the poor) before you do so. This is better for you, and purer. If you cannot afford it, then GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

13.Rashad Khalifa: If you failed to give to charity before conferring, then repented thereafter, GOD accepts your repentance. You shall observe the contact prayers (Salat), give the obligatory charity (Zakat), and obey GOD and His messenger. GOD is fully Cognizant of everything you do.

14.Rashad Khalifa: Have you noted those who befriended people with whom GOD is angry? They neither belong with you, nor with them. They deliberately swear lies!

15.Rashad Khalifa: GOD has prepared for them a severe retribution. Miserable indeed is what they used to do.

16.Rashad Khalifa: They used their oaths as a means of repelling from the path of GOD. Consequently, they have incurred a shameful retribution.

17.Rashad Khalifa: Neither their money, nor their children will help them against GOD. They have incurred the hellfire, wherein they abide forever.

18.Rashad Khalifa: The Day will come when GOD resurrects them all. They will swear to Him then, just as they swear to you now, thinking that they really are right! Indeed, they are the real liars.

19.Rashad Khalifa: The devil has possessed them, and has caused them to disregard GOD's message. These are the party of the devil. Absolutely, the party of the devil are the losers.

20.Rashad Khalifa: Surely, those who oppose GOD and His messenger will be with the lowliest.

21.Rashad Khalifa: GOD has decreed: "I and My messengers will most assuredly win." GOD is Powerful, Almighty.

22.Rashad Khalifa: You will not find people who believe in GOD and the Last Day befriending those who oppose GOD and His messenger, even if they were their parents, or their children, or their siblings, or their tribe. For these, He decrees faith into their hearts, and supports them with inspiration from Him, and admits them into gardens with flowing streams wherein they abide forever. GOD is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. These are the party of GOD. Most assuredly, GOD's party are the winners.

1.Rashad Khalifa: Glorifying GOD is everything in the heavens and the earth, and He is the Almighty, Most Wise.

2.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who evicted those who disbelieved among the people of the scripture from their homes in a mass exodus. You never thought that they would leave, and they thought that their preparations would protect them from GOD. But then GOD came to them whence they never expected, and threw terror into their hearts. Thus, they abandoned their homes on their own volition, in addition to pressure from the believers. You should learn from this, O you who possess vision.

3.Rashad Khalifa: If GOD did not force them to leave, He would have requited them in this life (even worse than forcing them to leave). In the Hereafter He will commit them to the retribution of Hell.

4.Rashad Khalifa: This is because they opposed GOD and His messenger. For those who oppose GOD and His messenger, GOD is most strict in enforcing retribution.

5.Rashad Khalifa: Whether you chop a tree or leave it standing on its trunk is in accordance with GOD's will. He will surely humiliate the wicked.

6.Rashad Khalifa: Whatever GOD restored for His messenger was not the result of your war efforts, whether you fought on horses or on foot. GOD is the One who sends His messengers against whomever He wills. GOD is Omnipotent.

7.Rashad Khalifa: Whatever GOD restored to His messenger from the (defeated) communities shall go to GOD and His messenger (in the form of a charity). You shall give it to the relatives, the orphans, the poor, and the traveling alien. Thus, it will not remain monopolized by the strong among you. You may keep the spoils given to you by the messenger, but do not take what he enjoins you from taking. You shall reverence GOD. GOD is strict in enforcing retribution.

8.Rashad Khalifa: (You shall give) to the needy who immigrated. They were evicted from their homes and deprived of their properties, because they sought GOD's grace and pleasure, and because they supported GOD and His messenger. They are the truthful.

9.Rashad Khalifa: As for those who provided them with a home and a refuge, and were believers before them, they love those who immigrated to them, and find no hesitation in their hearts in helping them. In fact, they readily give them priority over themselves, even when they themselves need what they give away. Indeed, those who overcome their natural stinginess are the successful ones.

10.Rashad Khalifa: Those who became believers after them say, "Our Lord, forgive us and our brethren who preceded us to the faith, and keep our hearts from harboring any hatred towards those who believed. Our Lord, You are Compassionate, Most Merciful."

11.Rashad Khalifa: Have you noted those who are plagued with hypocrisy, and how they said to their companions in disbelief among the people of the scripture, "If you are evicted we will go out with you, and will never obey anyone who opposes you. If anyone fights you, we will fight on your side." GOD bears witness that they are liars.

12.Rashad Khalifa: In fact, if they were evicted, they would not have gone out with them, and if anyone fought them, they would not have supported them. Even if they supported them, they would have turned around and fled. They could never win.

13.Rashad Khalifa: Indeed, you strike more terror in their hearts than their fear of GOD. This is because they are people who do not comprehend.

14.Rashad Khalifa: They do not get together to fight you unless they are in well-shielded buildings, or behind walls. Their might appears formidable among themselves. You would think that they are united, when in fact their hearts are divided. This is because they are people who do not understand.

15.Rashad Khalifa: Their fate is the same as their counterparts who preceded them. They suffered the consequences of their decisions. They have incurred a painful retribution.

16.Rashad Khalifa: They are like the devil: he says to the human being, "Disbelieve," then as soon as he disbelieves, he says, "I disown you. I fear GOD, Lord of the universe."

17.Rashad Khalifa: The destiny for both of them is the Hellfire, wherein they abide forever. This is the requital for the transgressors.

18.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, you shall reverence GOD, and let every soul examine what it has sent ahead for tomorrow. You shall reverence GOD; GOD is fully Cognizant of everything you do.

19.Rashad Khalifa: Do not be like those who forgot GOD, so He made them forget themselves. These are the wicked.

20.Rashad Khalifa: Not equal are the dwellers of the Hellfire and the dwellers of Paradise; the dwellers of Paradise are the winners.

21.Rashad Khalifa: If we revealed this Quran to a mountain, you would see it trembling, crumbling, out of reverence for GOD. We cite these examples for the people, that they may reflect.

22.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One GOD; there is no other god beside Him. Knower of all secrets and declarations. He is the Most Gracious, Most Merciful.

23.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One GOD; there is no other god beside Him. The King, the Most Sacred, the Peace, the Most Faithful, the Supreme, the Almighty, the Most Powerful, the Most Dignified. GOD be glorified; far above having partners.

24.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One GOD; the Creator, the Initiator, the Designer. To Him belong the most beautiful names. Glorifying Him is everything in the heavens and the earth. He is the Almighty, Most Wise

60.SurahEnglishNames: She That is to be Examined, Examining her, She Who is Tested

1.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, you shall not befriend My enemies and your enemies, extending love and friendship to them, even though they have disbelieved in the truth that has come to you. They persecute the messenger, and you, just because you believe in GOD, your Lord. If you mobilize to struggle in My cause, seeking My blessings, how can you secretly love them? I am fully aware of everything you conceal, and everything you declare. Those among you who do this have indeed strayed off the right path.

2.Rashad Khalifa: Whenever they encounter you, they treat you as enemies, and hurt you with their hands and tongues. They want you to disbelieve.

3.Rashad Khalifa: Your relatives and your money can never help you. On the Day of Resurrection, He will judge among you. GOD is Seer of everything you do.

4.Rashad Khalifa: A good example has been set for you by Abraham and those with him. They said to their people, "We disown you and the idols that you worship besides GOD. We denounce you, and you will see nothing from us except animosity and hatred until you believe in GOD ALONE." However, a mistake was committed by Abraham when he said to his father, "I will pray for your forgiveness, but I possess no power to protect you from GOD." "Our Lord, we trust in You, and submit to You; to You is the final destiny.

5.Rashad Khalifa: "Our Lord, let us not be oppressed by those who disbelieved, and forgive us. You are the Almighty, Most Wise."

6.Rashad Khalifa: A good example has been set by them for those who seek GOD and the Last Day. As for those who turn away, GOD is in no need (of them), Most Praiseworthy.

7.Rashad Khalifa: GOD may change the animosity between you and them into love. GOD is Omnipotent. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

8.Rashad Khalifa: GOD does not enjoin you from befriending those who do not fight you because of religion, and do not evict you from your homes. You may befriend them and be equitable towards them. GOD loves the equitable.

9.Rashad Khalifa: GOD enjoins you only from befriending those who fight you because of religion, evict you from your homes, and band together with others to banish you. You shall not befriend them. Those who befriend them are the transgressors.

10.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, when believing women (abandon the enemy and) ask for asylum with you, you shall test them. GOD is fully aware of their belief. Once you establish that they are believers, you shall not return them to the disbelievers. They are not lawful to remain married to them, nor shall the disbelievers be allowed to marry them. Give back the dowries that the disbelievers have paid. You commit no error by marrying them, so long as you pay them their due dowries. Do not keep disbelieving wives (if they wish to join the enemy). You may ask them for the dowry you had paid, and they may ask for what they paid. This is GOD's rule; He rules among you. GOD is Omniscient, Most Wise.

11.Rashad Khalifa: If any of your wives join the enemies' camp, and you are forced to fight, you shall force the enemy to compensate the men who lost their wives, by giving them what they spent on their wives. You shall reverence GOD, in whom you believe.

12.Rashad Khalifa: O you prophet, when the believing women (who abandoned the disbelievers) to seek asylum with you pledge to you that they will not set up any idols besides GOD, nor steal, nor commit adultery, nor kill their children, nor fabricate any falsehood, nor disobey your righteous orders, you shall accept their pledge, and pray to GOD to forgive them. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

13.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, do not befriend people with whom GOD is angry, and who are hopelessly stuck in disbelief; they are just as hopeless as the disbelievers who are already in the graves.

1.Rashad Khalifa: Glorifying GOD is everything in the heavens and everything on earth. He is the Almighty, Most Wise.

2.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, why do you say what you do not do?

3.Rashad Khalifa: Most abominable in the sight of GOD is that you say what you do not do.

4.Rashad Khalifa: GOD loves those who fight in His cause united in one column, like the bricks in one wall.

5.Rashad Khalifa: Recall that Moses said to his people, "O my people, why do you hurt me, even though you know that I am GOD's messenger to you?" When they deviated, GOD diverted their hearts. For GOD does not guide the wicked peopl

6.Rashad Khalifa: Recall that Jesus, son of Mary, said, "O Children of Israel, I am GOD's messenger to you, confirming the Torah and bringing good news of a messenger to come after me whose name will be even more praised (Ahmad)." Then, when he showed them the clear proofs, they said, "This is profound magic."

7.Rashad Khalifa: Who is more evil than one who fabricates lies about GOD, and he is being invited to Submission? GOD does not guide the evil people.

8.Rashad Khalifa: They wish to put out GOD's light with their mouths. But GOD insists upon perfecting His light, in spite of the disbelievers.

9.Rashad Khalifa: He has sent His messenger with the guidance and the true religion, and will make it dominate all religions, in spite of the idol worshipers.

10.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, let Me inform you of a trade that will save you from painful retribution.

11.Rashad Khalifa: Believe in GOD and His messenger and strive in the cause of GOD with your money and your lives. This is the best deal for you, if you only knew.

12.Rashad Khalifa: In return, He forgives your sins, and admits you into gardens with flowing streams, with beautiful mansions in the gardens of Eden. This is the greatest triumph.

13.Rashad Khalifa: Additionally, you get something you truly love: support from GOD and guaranteed victory. Give good news to the believers.

14.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, be GOD's supporters, like the disciples of Jesus, son of Mary. When he said to them, "Who are my supporters towards GOD," they said, "We are GOD's supporters." Thus, a group from the Children of Israel believed, and another group disbelieved. We helped those who believed against their enemy, until they won.

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.Rashad Khalifa: Glorifying GOD is everything in the heavens and everything on earth; the King, the Most Sacred, the Almighty, the Most Wise.

2.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who sent to the gentiles a messenger from among them, to recite to them His revelations, purify them, and teach them the scripture and wisdom. Before this, they had gone far astray.

3.Rashad Khalifa: And to many generations subsequent to them. He is the Almighty, Most Wise.

4.Rashad Khalifa: Such is GOD's grace that He bestows upon whomever He wills. GOD is Possessor of Infinite Grace.

5.Rashad Khalifa: The example of those who were given the Torah, then failed to uphold it, is like the donkey carrying great works of literature. Miserable indeed is the example of people who rejected GOD's revelations. GOD does not guide the wicked people.

6.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "O you who are Jewish, if you claim that you are GOD's chosen, to the exclusion of all other people, then you should long for death if you are truthful!"

7.Rashad Khalifa: They will never long for it, because of what they have committed. GOD is fully aware of the wicked.

8.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "The death that you are trying to evade will catch up with you sooner or later. Then you will be returned to the Knower of all secrets and declarations, then He will inform you of everything you had done."

9.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, when the Congregational Prayer (Salat Al-Jumu`ah) is announced on Friday, you shall hasten to the commemoration of GOD, and drop all business. This is better for you, if you only knew.

10.Rashad Khalifa: Once the prayer is completed, you may spread through the land to seek GOD's bounties, and continue to remember GOD frequently, that you may succeed.

11.Rashad Khalifa: When some of them come across a business deal, or some entertainment, they rush to it and leave you standing! Say, "What GOD possesses is far better than the entertainment or the business. GOD is the best Provider."

1.Rashad Khalifa: When the hypocrites come to you they say, "We bear witness that you are the messenger of GOD." GOD knows that you are His messenger, and GOD bears witness that the hypocrites are liars.

2.Rashad Khalifa: Under the guise of their apparent faith, they repel the people from the path of GOD. Miserable indeed is what they do.

3.Rashad Khalifa: This is because they believed, then disbelieved. Hence, their minds are blocked; they do not understand.

4.Rashad Khalifa: When you see them, you may be impressed by their looks. And when they speak, you may listen to their eloquence. They are like standing logs. They think that every call is intended against them. These are the real enemies; beware of them. GOD condemns them; they have deviate

5.Rashad Khalifa: When they are told, "Come let the messenger of GOD pray for your forgiveness," they mockingly turn their heads, and you see them repel others and act arrogantly.

6.Rashad Khalifa: It is the same for them, whether you pray for their forgiveness, or not pray for their forgiveness; GOD will not forgive them. For GOD does not guide the wicked people.

7.Rashad Khalifa: They are the ones who say, "Do not give any money to those who followed the messenger of GOD, perhaps they abandon him!" However, GOD possesses the treasures of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not comprehend.

8.Rashad Khalifa: They say, "If we go back to the city, the powerful therein will evict the weak (and we will be victimized)." (They should know that) all dignity belongs to GOD and His messenger, and the believers. However, the hypocrites do not know.

9.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, do not be distracted by your money and your children from remembering GOD. Those who do this are the losers.

10.Rashad Khalifa: You shall give from our provisions to you before death comes to you, then you say, "My Lord, if only You could delay this for a short while! I would then be charitable and join the righteous!"

11.Rashad Khalifa: GOD never delays the appointed time of death for any soul. GOD is fully Cognizant of everything you do.

1.Rashad Khalifa: Glorifying GOD is everything in the heavens and everything on earth. To Him belongs all kingship, and to Him belongs all praise, and He is Omnipotent.

2.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who created you, then among you there is the disbeliever, and the believer. GOD is fully Seer of everything you do.

3.Rashad Khalifa: He created the heavens and the earth for a specific purpose, designed you and perfected your design, then to Him is the final destiny.

4.Rashad Khalifa: He knows everything in the heavens and the earth, and He knows everything you conceal and everything you declare. GOD is fully aware of the innermost thoughts.

5.Rashad Khalifa: Have you noted those who disbelieved in the past, then suffered the consequences of their decision? They incurred a painful retribution.

6.Rashad Khalifa: This is because their messengers went to them with clear proofs, but they said, "Shall we follow humans like us?" They disbelieved and turned away. GOD does not need them; GOD is in no need, Praiseworthy.

7.Rashad Khalifa: Those who disbelieved claim that they will not be resurrected! Yes indeed, by my Lord, you will be resurrected, and you will be held accountable for everything you have done. This is easy for GOD to do.

8.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, you shall believe in GOD and His messenger, and the light that we have revealed herein. GOD is fully Cognizant of everything you do.

9.Rashad Khalifa: The day will come when He summons you to the Day of Summoning. That is the Day of Mutual Blaming. Anyone who believes in GOD and leads a righteous life, He will remit his sins, and will admit him into gardens with flowing streams. They abide therein forever. This is the greatest triumph.

10.Rashad Khalifa: As for those who disbelieve and reject our revelations, they are the dwellers of the Hellfire; they abide therein forever. What a miserable destiny!

11.Rashad Khalifa: Nothing happens to you except in accordance with GOD's will. Anyone who believes in GOD, He will guide his heart. GOD is fully aware of all things.

12.Rashad Khalifa: You shall obey GOD and you shall obey the messenger. If you turn away, then the sole mission of our messenger is to deliver the message.

13.Rashad Khalifa: GOD: there is no other god besides Him. In GOD the believers shall trust.

14.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, your spouses and your children can be your enemies; beware. If you pardon, forget, and forgive, then GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

15.Rashad Khalifa: Your money and children are a test, and GOD possesses a great recompense.

16.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, you shall reverence GOD as much as you can, and listen, and obey, and give (to charity) for your own good. Anyone who is protected from his own stinginess, these are the successful ones.

17.Rashad Khalifa: If you lend GOD a loan of righteousness, He will multiply the reward for you manifold, and forgive you. GOD is Appreciative, Clement.

18.Rashad Khalifa: The Knower of all secrets and declarations; the Almighty, Most Wise.

1.Rashad Khalifa: O you prophet, when you people divorce the women, you shall ensure that a divorce interim is fulfilled. You shall measure such an interim precisely. You shall reverence GOD your Lord. Do not evict them from their homes, nor shall you make life miserable for them, to force them to leave on their own, unless they commit a proven adultery. These are GOD's laws. Anyone who transgresses GOD's laws commits an injustice against himself. You never know; maybe GOD wills something good to come out of this.

2.Rashad Khalifa: Once the interim is fulfilled, you may reconcile with them equitably, or go through with the separation equitably. You shall have two equitable witnesses witness the divorce before GOD. This is to enlighten those who believe in GOD and the Last Day. Anyone who reverences GOD, He will create an exit for him.

3.Rashad Khalifa: And will provide for him whence he never expected. Anyone who trusts in GOD, He suffices him. GOD's commands are done. GOD has decreed for everything its fate.

4.Rashad Khalifa: As for the women who have reached menopause, if you have any doubts, their interim shall be three months. As for those who do not menstruate, and discover that they are pregnant, their interim ends upon giving birth. Anyone who reverences GOD, He makes everything easy for him.

5.Rashad Khalifa: This is GOD's command that He sends down to you. Anyone who reverences GOD, He remits his sins, and rewards him generously.

6.Rashad Khalifa: You shall allow them to live in the same home in which they lived with you, and do not make life so miserable for them that they leave on their own. If they are pregnant, you shall spend on them until they give birth. If they nurse the infant, you shall pay them for this service. You shall maintain the amicable relations among you. If you disagree, you may hire another woman to nurse the chil

7.Rashad Khalifa: The rich husband shall provide support in accordance with his means, and the poor shall provide according to the means that GOD bestowed upon him. GOD does not impose on any soul more than He has given it. GOD will provide ease after difficulty.

8.Rashad Khalifa: Many a community rebelled against the commands of its Lord and against His messengers. Consequently, we held them strictly accountable, and requited them a terrible requital.

9.Rashad Khalifa: They suffered the consequences of their decisions; a profound loss.

10.Rashad Khalifa: GOD has prepared for them severe retribution. Therefore, you shall reverence GOD, O you who possess intelligence and believed. GOD has sent down to you a message -

11.Rashad Khalifa: a messenger who recites to you GOD's revelations, clearly, to lead those who believe and work righteousness out of the darkness into the light. Anyone who believes in GOD and leads a righteous life, He will admit him into gardens with flowing streams; they abide therein forever. GOD will generously reward him.

12.Rashad Khalifa: GOD created seven universes and the same number of earths. The commands flow among them. This is to let you know that GOD is Omnipotent, and that GOD is fully aware of all thing

1.Rashad Khalifa: O you prophet, why do you prohibit what GOD has made lawful for you, just to please your wives? GOD is Forgiver, Merciful.

2.Rashad Khalifa: GOD has decreed for you the laws dealing with your oaths. GOD is your Lord, and He is the Omniscient, Most Wise.

3.Rashad Khalifa: The prophet had trusted some of his wives with a certain statement, then one of them spread it, and GOD let him know about it. He then informed his wife of part of the issue, and disregarded part. She asked him, "Who informed you of this?" He said, "I was informed by the Omniscient, Most Cognizant."

4.Rashad Khalifa: If the two of you repent to GOD, then your hearts have listened. But if you band together against him, then GOD is his ally, and so is Gabriel and the righteous believers. Also, the angels are his helpers.

5.Rashad Khalifa: If he divorces you, his Lord will substitute other wives in your place who are better than you; submitters (Muslims), believers (Mu'mins), obedient, repentant, worshipers, pious, either previously married, or virgins.

6.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, protect yourselves and your families from the Hellfire whose fuel is people and rocks. Guarding it are stern and powerful angels who never disobey GOD; they do whatever they are commanded to do.

7.Rashad Khalifa: O you who disbelieved, do not apologize today. You are being requited only for what you did.

8.Rashad Khalifa: O you who believe, you shall repent to GOD a firm repentance. Your Lord will then remit your sins and admit you into gardens with flowing streams. On that day, GOD will not disappoint the prophet and those who believed with him. Their light will radiate in front of them and to their right. They will say, "Our Lord, perfect our light for us, and forgive us; You are Omnipotent."

9.Rashad Khalifa: O prophet, struggle against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be stern with them. Their abode is Gehenna, and a miserable destiny.

10.Rashad Khalifa: GOD cites as examples of those who disbelieved the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were married to two of our righteous servants, but they betrayed them and, consequently, they could not help them at all against GOD. The two of them were told, "Enter the Hell-fire with those who deserved it."

11.Rashad Khalifa: And GOD cites as an example of those who believed the wife of Pharaoh. She said, "My Lord, build a home for me at You in Paradise, and save me from Pharaoh and his works; save me from the transgressing people."

12.Rashad Khalifa: Also Mary, the Amramite. She maintained her chastity, then we blew into her from our spirit. She believed in the words of her Lord and His scriptures; she was obedient

1.Rashad Khalifa: Most exalted is the One in whose hands is all kingship, and He is Omnipotent.

2.Rashad Khalifa: The One who created death and life for the purpose of distinguishing those among you who would do better. He is the Almighty, the Forgiving.

3.Rashad Khalifa: He created seven universes in layers. You do not see any imperfection in the creation by the Most Gracious. Keep looking; do you see any flaw?

4.Rashad Khalifa: Look again and again; your eyes will come back stumped and conquered.

5.Rashad Khalifa: We adorned the lowest universe with lamps, and guarded its borders with projectiles against the devils; we prepared for them a retribution in Hell.

6.Rashad Khalifa: For those who disbelieved in their Lord, the retribution of Gehenna. What a miserable destiny.

7.Rashad Khalifa: When they get thrown therein, they hear its furor as it fumes.

8.Rashad Khalifa: It almost explodes from rage. Whenever a group is thrown therein, its guards would ask them, "Did you not receive a warner?"

9.Rashad Khalifa: They would answer, "Yes indeed; a warner did come to us, but we disbelieved and said, `GOD did not reveal anything. You are totally astray.' "

10.Rashad Khalifa: They also say, "If we heard or understood, we would not be among the dwellers of Hell!"

11.Rashad Khalifa: Thus, they confessed their sins. Woe to the dwellers of Hell.

12.Rashad Khalifa: As for those who reverence their Lord, when alone in their privacy, they have attained forgiveness and a great recompense.

13.Rashad Khalifa: Whether you keep your utterances secret, or declare them, He is fully aware of the innermost thoughts.

14.Rashad Khalifa: Should He not know what He created? He is the Sublime, Most Cognizant.

15.Rashad Khalifa: He is the One who put the Earth at your service. Roam its corners, and eat from His provisions. To Him is the final summoning.

16.Rashad Khalifa: Have you guaranteed that the One in heaven will not strike the earth and cause it to tumble?

17.Rashad Khalifa: Have you guaranteed that the One in heaven will not send upon you a violent storm? Will you then appreciate the value of My warning?

18.Rashad Khalifa: Others before them have disbelieved; how terrible was My requital!

19.Rashad Khalifa: Have they not seen the birds above them lined up in columns and spreading their wings? The Most Gracious is the One who holds them in the air. He is Seer of all things.

20.Rashad Khalifa: Where are those soldiers who can help you against the Most Gracious? Indeed, the disbelievers are deceived.

21.Rashad Khalifa: Who is there to provide for you, if He withholds His provisions? Indeed, they have plunged deep into transgression and aversion.

22.Rashad Khalifa: Is one who walks while slumped over on his face better guided, or one who walks straight on the right path?

23.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "He is the One who initiated you, and granted you the hearing, the eyes, and the brains. Rarely are you appreciative."

24.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "He is the One who placed you on earth, and before Him you will be summoned."

25.Rashad Khalifa: They challenge: "When will that prophecy come to pass, if you are truthful?"

26.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "Such knowledge is with GOD; I am no more than a manifest warner."

27.Rashad Khalifa: When they see it happening, the faces of those who disbelieved will turn miserable, and it will be proclaimed: "This is what you used to mock."

28.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "Whether GOD decides to annihilate me and those with me, or to shower us with His mercy, who is there to protect the disbelievers from a painful retribution?"

29.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "He is the Most Gracious; we believe in Him, and we trust in Him. You will surely find out who is really far astray."

30.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "What if your water sinks away, who will provide you with pure water?"

1.Rashad Khalifa: NuN, the pen, and what they (the people) write.

2.Rashad Khalifa: You have attained a great blessing from your Lord; you are not crazy.

3.Rashad Khalifa: You have attained a recompense that is well deserved.

4.Rashad Khalifa: You are blessed with a great moral character.

5.Rashad Khalifa: You will see, and they will see.

6.Rashad Khalifa: Which of you are condemne

7.Rashad Khalifa: Your Lord is fully aware of those who strayed off His path, and He is fully aware of those who are guided.

8.Rashad Khalifa: Do not obey the rejectors.

9.Rashad Khalifa: They wish that you compromise, so they too can compromise.

10.Rashad Khalifa: Do not obey every lowly swearer.

11.Rashad Khalifa: A slanderer, a backbiter.

12.Rashad Khalifa: Forbidder of charity, a transgressor, a sinner.

13.Rashad Khalifa: Unappreciative, and greedy.

14.Rashad Khalifa: Even though he possessed enough money and children.

15.Rashad Khalifa: When our revelations are recited to him, he says, "Tales from the past!"

16.Rashad Khalifa: We will mark his face.

17.Rashad Khalifa: We have tested them like we tested the owners of the garden who swore that they will harvest it in the morning.

18.Rashad Khalifa: They were so absolutely sure.

19.Rashad Khalifa: A passing (storm) from your Lord passed by it while they were asleep.

20.Rashad Khalifa: By morning, it was barren.

21.Rashad Khalifa: They called on each other in the morning.

22.Rashad Khalifa: "Let us harvest the crop."

23.Rashad Khalifa: On their way, they confided to each other.

24.Rashad Khalifa: That from then on, none of them would be poor.

25.Rashad Khalifa: They were so absolutely sure of their harvest.

26.Rashad Khalifa: But when they saw it, they said, "We were so wrong!

27.Rashad Khalifa: "Now, we have nothing!"

28.Rashad Khalifa: The righteous among them said, "If only you had glorified (God)!"

29.Rashad Khalifa: They said, "Glory be to our Lord. We have transgressed."

30.Rashad Khalifa: They started to blame each other.

31.Rashad Khalifa: They said, "Woe to us. We sinned.

32.Rashad Khalifa: "May our Lord grant us a better one. We repent to our Lord."

33.Rashad Khalifa: Such was the requital. But the retribution of the Hereafter is far worse, if they only knew.

34.Rashad Khalifa: The righteous have deserved, at their Lord, gardens of bliss.

35.Rashad Khalifa: Shall we treat the Submitters like the criminals?

36.Rashad Khalifa: What is wrong with your logic?

37.Rashad Khalifa: Do you have another book to uphold?

38.Rashad Khalifa: In it, do you find anything you want?

39.Rashad Khalifa: Or, have you received solemn assurances from us that grant you whatever you wish on the Day of Resurrection?

40.Rashad Khalifa: Ask them, "Who guarantees this for you?"

41.Rashad Khalifa: Do they have idols? Let their idols help them, if they are truthful.

42.Rashad Khalifa: The day will come when they will be exposed, and they will be required to fall prostrate, but they will be unable to.

43.Rashad Khalifa: With their eyes subdued, humiliation will cover them. They were invited to fall prostrate when they were whole and able.

44.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, let Me deal with those who reject this Hadith; we will lead them on whence they never perceive.

45.Rashad Khalifa: I will give them enough rope; My scheming is formidable.

46.Rashad Khalifa: Are you asking them for money, so they are burdened by the fine?

47.Rashad Khalifa: Do they know the future? Do they have it recorded?

48.Rashad Khalifa: You shall steadfastly persevere in carrying out the commands of your Lord. Do not be like (Jonah) who called from inside the fish.

49.Rashad Khalifa: If it were not for his Lord's grace, he would have been ejected into the desert as a sinner.

50.Rashad Khalifa: But his Lord blessed him, and made him righteous.

51.Rashad Khalifa: Those who disbelieved show their ridicule in their eyes when they hear the message and say, "He is crazy!"

52.Rashad Khalifa: It is in fact a message to the world.

11.Rashad Khalifa: The flood was devastating, so we carried you on the floating (ark).

12.Rashad Khalifa: We rendered it a lesson for you, that any listening ear may understand.

13.Rashad Khalifa: When the horn is blown onc

15.Rashad Khalifa: That is the day when the inevitable event will come to pass.

16.Rashad Khalifa: The heaven will crack, and fall apart.

17.Rashad Khalifa: The angels will be all around, and Your Lord's dominion will then encompass eight (universes).

18.Rashad Khalifa: On that day, you will be exposed, nothing of you can be hidde

19.Rashad Khalifa: As for the one who receives his record with his right hand, he will say, "Come read my record.

20.Rashad Khalifa: "I did believe that I was going to be held accountable."

21.Rashad Khalifa: He has deserved a happy life.

22.Rashad Khalifa: In an exalted Paradis

23.Rashad Khalifa: Its fruits are within reach.

24.Rashad Khalifa: Eat and drink happily in return for your works in days past.

25.Rashad Khalifa: As for him who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I never received my recor

26.Rashad Khalifa: "I wish I never knew my account.

27.Rashad Khalifa: "I wish my death was eterna

28.Rashad Khalifa: "My money cannot help me.

29.Rashad Khalifa: "All my power is gone."

30.Rashad Khalifa: Take him and shackle him.

31.Rashad Khalifa: Burn him in Hell.

32.Rashad Khalifa: In a chain that is seventy arms long, tie him up.

33.Rashad Khalifa: For he did not believe in GOD, Most Great.

34.Rashad Khalifa: Nor did he advocate the feeding of the poor.

35.Rashad Khalifa: Consequently, he has no friend here.

36.Rashad Khalifa: Nor any food, except the bitter variety.

37.Rashad Khalifa: Food for the sinners.

38.Rashad Khalifa: I swear by what you se

39.Rashad Khalifa: And what you do not see.

40.Rashad Khalifa: This is the utterance of an honorable messenger.

41.Rashad Khalifa: Not the utterance of a poet; rarely do you believe.

42.Rashad Khalifa: Nor the utterance of a soothsayer; rarely do you take heed

43.Rashad Khalifa: A revelation from the Lord of the universe.

44.Rashad Khalifa: Had he uttered any other teachings.

45.Rashad Khalifa: We would have punished him.

46.Rashad Khalifa: We would have stopped the revelations to him.

47.Rashad Khalifa: None of you could have helped him.

48.Rashad Khalifa: This is a reminder for the righteous.

49.Rashad Khalifa: We know; some of you are rejectors.

50.Rashad Khalifa: It is but sorrow for the disbelievers.

51.Rashad Khalifa: It is the absolute truth.

52.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, you shall glorify the name of your Lord, Most Great.

1.Rashad Khalifa: A questioner may question the inevitable retribution.

2.Rashad Khalifa: For the disbelievers, none can stop it.

3.Rashad Khalifa: From GOD; Possessor of the highest Height.

4.Rashad Khalifa: The angels, with their reports, climb to Him in a day that equals fifty thousand years.

5.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, you shall resort to a gracious patience.

6.Rashad Khalifa: KHALIFA:For they see it far away.

7.Rashad Khalifa: While we see it very close.

8.Rashad Khalifa: The day will come when the sky will be like molten rocks.

11.Rashad Khalifa: When they see them, the guilty will wish he could give his own children as ransom, to spare him the retribution of that day.

12.Rashad Khalifa: Also his spouse, and his brothe

13.Rashad Khalifa: Even his whole tribe that raised him.

14.Rashad Khalifa: Even all the people on earth, if it would save him.

16.Rashad Khalifa: KHALIFA:Eager to burn.

17.Rashad Khalifa: It calls on those who turned away.

18.Rashad Khalifa: Those who hoarded and counted.

19.Rashad Khalifa: Indeed, the human being is anxious.

20.Rashad Khalifa: If touched by adversity, despondent.

21.Rashad Khalifa: If blessed by wealth, stingy.

22.Rashad Khalifa: Except for the worshipers.

23.Rashad Khalifa: Who always observe their contact prayers (Salat).

24.Rashad Khalifa: Part of their money is set aside.

25.Rashad Khalifa: For the poor and the need

26.Rashad Khalifa: They believe in the Day of Judgment.

27.Rashad Khalifa: They reverence their Lord's requital.

28.Rashad Khalifa: Their Lord's requital is not taken for granted.

29.Rashad Khalifa: They keep their chastity.

30.Rashad Khalifa: (They have relations) only with their spouses, or what is legally theirs

31.Rashad Khalifa: anyone who transgresses these limits is a sinner.

32.Rashad Khalifa: And the believers keep their word; they are trustworthy.

33.Rashad Khalifa: Their testimony is truthful.

34.Rashad Khalifa: They consistently observe their contact prayers (Salat) on time.

35.Rashad Khalifa: They have deserved a position of honor in Paradise.

36.Rashad Khalifa: What is keeping those who disbelieved from joining you?

37.Rashad Khalifa: To the right, and to the left, they flee.

38.Rashad Khalifa: How can any of them expect to enter the blissful Paradise?

39.Rashad Khalifa: Never; we created them, and they know from what.

40.Rashad Khalifa: I solemnly swear by the Lord of the easts and the wests; we are able -

41.Rashad Khalifa: KHALIFA:to substitute better people in your place; we can never be defeated.

42.Rashad Khalifa: Therefore, let them blunder and play, until they meet the day that is awaiting them.

43.Rashad Khalifa: That is the day they come out of the graves in a hurry, as if herded to the (sacrificial) altars.

44.Rashad Khalifa: With their eyes subdued, shame will cover them. That is the day that is awaiting them.

1.Rashad Khalifa: We sent Noah to his people: "You shall warn your people before a painful retribution afflicts them."

2.Rashad Khalifa: He said, "O my people, I am a manifest warner to you.

3.Rashad Khalifa: "To alert you that you shall worship GOD, reverence Him, and obey me.

4.Rashad Khalifa: "He will then forgive you your sins and respite you for a predetermined period. Most assuredly, GOD's appointment can never be delayed, once it is due, if you only knew."

5.Rashad Khalifa: He said, "My Lord, I have invited my people night and day.

6.Rashad Khalifa: "But my invitation only increased their aversion.

7.Rashad Khalifa: "Whenever I invited them to be forgiven by You, they placed their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their clothes, insisted, and turned arrogant.

1.Rashad Khalifa: Say, "I was inspired that a group of jinns listened, then said, `We have heard a wonderful Quran.

8.Rashad Khalifa: " `We touched the heaven and found it filled with formidable guards and projectiles.

11.Rashad Khalifa: " `Some of us are righteous, and some are less than righteous; we follow various paths.

12.Rashad Khalifa: " `We knew full well that we can never run away from GOD on Earth; we can never run away and escape.

13.Rashad Khalifa: " `When we heard the guidance, we believed therein. Anyone who believes in his Lord will never fear any injustice, nor any affliction.

14.Rashad Khalifa: " `Among us are the submitters, and among us are the compromisers.' " As for those who submitted, they are on the right path.

18.Rashad Khalifa: The places of worship belong to GOD; do not call on anyone else beside GOD.

19.Rashad Khalifa: When GOD's servant advocated Him alone, almost all of them banded together to oppose him.

73.SurahEnglishNames: The Enshrouded One, Bundled Up, The Mantled One

4.Rashad Khalifa: Or a little more. And read the Quran from cover to cover.

12.Rashad Khalifa: We have severe punishments, and Hell.

13.Rashad Khalifa: Food that can hardly be swallowed, and painful retribution.

14.Rashad Khalifa: The day will come when the earth and the mountains will quake, and the mountains will turn into a weightless pile.

15.Rashad Khalifa: We have sent to you a messenger, just as we sent to Pharaoh a messenger.

16.Rashad Khalifa: Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger and, consequently, we punished him severely.

17.Rashad Khalifa: If you disbelieve, how can you evade a day so terrible that it makes the infants gray-haired?

18.Rashad Khalifa: The heaven will shatter therefrom. His promise is true.

19.Rashad Khalifa: This is a reminder; whoever wills, let him choose the path to his Lord.

20.Rashad Khalifa: Your Lord knows that you meditate during two-thirds of the night, or half of it, or one-third of it, and so do some of those who believed with you. GOD has designed the night and the day, and He knows that you cannot always do this. He has pardoned you. Instead, you shall read what you can of the Quran. He knows that some of you may be ill, others may be traveling in pursuit of GOD's provisions, and others may be striving in the cause of GOD. You shall read what you can of it, and observe the contact prayers (Salat), give the obligatory charity (Zakat), and lend GOD a loan of righteousness. Whatever good you send ahead on behalf of your souls, you will find it at GOD far better and generously rewarded. And implore GOD for forgiveness. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
